reviewText:
Alright, guys. Buckle your seat belts because this is gonna be a long review. Please remember that this consists of my opinion.

OVERVIEW

Warface is a first-person shooter that has a Call of Duty-esque vibe to it. While some call it a CoD ripoff, I tend to disagree. Some people like it more than CoD, some don't. Having played both, I personally find Warface more entertaining than the more recent installments of the CoD franchise (i.e. MW3, Ghosts, Advanced Warfare).

CAN I RUN IT?

I have a modern day low-spec PC and I can run Warface comfortably with minimal to no lag (EDIT: by lag I mean framerate drops. You're welcome, salty guy in the comments. I took a whole minute out of my day to satisfy you even though I guarantee you will never read this review again.). Sorry about that. Anyways, obviously, it will run different for everyone. If you know your computer specs, you can use this website to find out if you can run it (No download required):
http://www.game-debate.com/games/index.php?g_id=1359&game=Warface
I have found it to be pretty accurate for most games.

SPECIFIC TOPICS

HACKERS
While many reviewers say the game is full of hackers, I disagree. I have played Warface for a reasonable amount of time and have not come across any hackers. The way the game is designed, it is common for a skilled - let me say that again, SKILLED player to obtain 50-60 kills in a single team deathmatch game. While it isn't too common, it isn't a rarity either. Newer players will commonly mistake these skilled players for hackers, but they are clearly not. However, I'm not saying there aren't hackers, because I'm sure there are.

PAY TO WIN
Many reviewers also say this game is pay to win. You can purchase Kredits and boosters that allow you to level up faster and purchase weapons and items that are superior to others. However, I have found that when I play matches I have more difficulty winning against skilled players with typical gear than players with lots of gear that just suck. So, yes, you can buy better stuff, no, it isn't that noticeable in the game.

GAMEMODES
This game has three major categories: Co-op, Versus, and Special Operations (I have not yet unlocked Spec Ops so it will not be covered in this review).
In Co-op, up to five players can play in Regular, Skilled, and Advanced missions to obtain checkpoints and goals in order to get experience and money. (I recommend learning the basics of the game before jumping into Co-op)
Versus is where you will be most often. You will start out being able to play Team Deathmatch, Free for All, and Plant the Bomb (which is basically Casual mode from CS:GO). After achieving rank 9 you will unlock other gamemodes like Capture (Capture the Flag), Storm (Attack and Defend), Domination, and a couple others that I can't remember at the moment. Players below rank 9 are considered Rookies" and players above rank 9 are considered "Professionals". Rookies can only play with rookies and Professionals with Professionals.

FEATURES

CLANS
This game has clans
date: where your clan name appears above your username. I don't know too much about clans
recommended:
but I know there is a way to play clan versus clan.

THE FREAKING SLIDE FEATURE HOLY CRAP
One of the selling points of this game is the slide feature. This is the coolest
hoursPlayed: most ridiculous feature I have ever seen in an FPS game. It is amazing. While you are sprinting
voteText: you can press a button (I don't remember the default key) to slide across the ground. You can ADS (aim down sight)
helpfulPercent: shoot
votesHelpful: switch weapons
votesFunny:
etc. while sliding. There is nothing more entertaining than sliding by an enemy with a sniper rifle or shotgun and shooting them in the face.

CLASSES
There are 4 classes: Rifleman
commentsCount: Medic
column16: Engineer
column17: and Sniper. Rifleman has an assault rifle or light machine gun
column18: a pistol
column21: and ammo boxes to replenish ammo for you or a team mate. Medic has a shotgun
column25: health kit (for yourself or a team mate)
column26: and a defibrillator. Engineer has a sub machine gun
column30: armor patches (to replenish armor for you or a team mate)
column31: and a claymore. Sniper has a sniper rifle
column34:
and grenade.

TEAM ASSIST
You and your team mates can help each other get to higher elevations by one team member giving the other a lift. You would be surprised by how many people will actually take 3 seconds out of their day to help you up a wall. I expected it to never happen
column35: like trying to get helped up in TDM in CoD
column37:
a lot of people will help you out.

CUSTOMIZATION
You can customize both your outfit and your username display in Warface. There are different helmets
column40: and armor that each have different stats and features. For example
column41: a certain type of helmet will allow you to see enemy claymores and mines. You can also customize the way your username appears
column42:
with a certain pattern in the background and icons next to your name (these things have to be unlocked by getting achievements).

BUGS/CONS

SERVER LATENCY
Unfortunately
column43: the servers are not very impressive. Some servers are absolutely fine
column44: but sometimes there are servers where it takes a fraction of a second longer to see that you got the kill (this is not my internet
column45:
this happens with other people too)

TEAM COLLISION
Team collision is a little wonky in this game. Instead of feeling like you hit a brick wall like in CS:GO
column46: you have more of a push-back feeling like running into a powerful fan. If you're not careful
column47: you can fall of a narrow ledge if you and a team mate try and go at the same time.\n\nTHE RANKING UP BUG (Don't worry
column48: it is only aesthetic)\nEDIT: THIS HAS BEEN FIXED AS OF October 2015\nWhen you rank up
column49: it will tell you that you rank up to a rank higher than what you are. ALWAYS. It is not too big of a deal though. In the bottom left corner of the regular menu
column50: it will show your correct rank number and name (For example
column51: Rank 9: Private). On the experience progress bar
column52: it will tell you what your next rank will be (For example
column53: NEXT RANK: Private First Class) This is also correct information. However
column55: it will tell you that you have become a rank one higher than what you are. So
column56: when you reach Private First Class it will have a message that says You have received the rank Specialist! even though you have not. However
column57: in the menu it will say Rank 10: Private First Class and the progress bar will say NEXT RANK: Specialist. So it's not a big deal
column58:
but definitely a noticeable one.

CHOOSE YOUR NAME WISELY
When you register for a Warface account
column59: choose your username wisely. You will only be given the option to create your name once
column60: so be sure its the one you want. If you decide someday that you really want to change your username
column61:
you can contact crytek support and they will change your name for you (I know this because I mispelled my name upon registry). They will only allow you to change your name once.

VERDICT

Overall
column62: Warface is an extremely entertaining game for people that like the FPS genre. Although it has some issues (like all games)
column63: they ultimately don't affect the game as a whole all that much. I intend to put many more hours into this game. And in the end
column64: DOWNLOAD IT! It's free to play so why not? If you don't like it
column65: no harm done. There's an uninstall button for a reason.\n\nIf you liked the review
column66: please let me know by hitting the thumbs up button below. Thanks

reviewText:
Well , some friends have finally convinced me to play this game. When I saw the trailer I was very confident and excited about this little title crytek have decided to launch. It showed me pretty interesting mechanics and things I have never seen in a free to play game. And when i actually saw that crytek made it i jumped up and i told myself : this means a new era for free to play games.
Well , i was wrong . I was so very wrong.

The game
The game focuses on straight infantry combat. You start the game and jump right in the tutorial with no explanation about what is going on . Some female voice tells you everything that you need to know about classes , movement mechanics , weapons etc. After you finish the tutorial you get a weapon which only lasts a week ( I will talk about this MAJOR problem later on ) . You get to choose whether you want to jump in a game through matchmaking or through dedicated servers. I truly recommend dedicated servers because you can find a game faster and you skip the 20 minutes wait time until you find a server that is empty in matchmaking.

The gameplay
The gameplay itself has some next-gen elements in it , such as : helping a teammate climb a higher structure by boosting him up , reviving ( not really next-gen but oh well ) and also  SLIDING  . I said SLIDING in bold text because i want to point out that it is OP ( OverPowered )  , meaning that when you slide , you can also shoot. This makes it so that when you see a dude , slide and shoot towards him and he's dead. No matter his skill , level etc , he will not notice you and you will get an easy kill. It was slightly nerfed since i first played this game in the closed beta , but it is still OP.
The game also has classes , which are primitive and remind me of Battlefield 4 . You get the same generic classes you see in every shooter ( medic , sniper , engineer , and rifleman ) . The one that somehow stands out is the rifleman , which is somehow a support from Battlefield , but with the ability to give himself ammo without droping it .
Anyway , you've probably played other shooters and you know how they handle.
The gunplay is very unbalanced. You start out with some ♥♥♥♥♥♥ weapons which are actually waterguns because all their stats are set to 1 ( out of 100 ) , and all of your enemies are higher levels with weapons that seem like very small miniguns combined with Counter Strike AWP's . In other words , you will lose every single battle if you don't have proper cover.
The maps are very small . Actually , they are smaller than Nuketown in Call of Duty . No need for more words here

The main problem with the game
MICROTRANSACTIONS EVERYWHERE!!!!
Yes , you will be swarmed in little ads with weapons or clothing that doesn't do anything . These items will continue to appear on the screen until you buy them . And the worst part ? You will struggle to kill and kill and kill for money , money , money , and when you have enough money to buy another ♥♥♥♥♥♥ item with all the stats 2 , you will rage and throw your PC out the window when you will notice that it will only be available for one week . Of course , until you buy a Premium account that will cost extra money ( real money )

The final verdict Overall , i DO NOT recommend this game. Don't let the screenshots and trailers fool you. It's not worth it. It will never be , because this is what the corporations do to the developers: They make them create unfinished games like this one

3.5/10

reviewText:
Before you say that I barely played this game then let me inform you that I played this game when it was in closed beta testing as a browser game about 10 months ago. I just downloaded it to try it now that its on steam to see if there are any big changes and here is what I found.

The game still has the same horrible cash shop as before and I really dislike cash shops like this where you can buy weapons and gear for real money, or you can buy them with ingame credits that takes a while to earn and the weapon only last for about 7 or 14 days (alot of guns are permanent though). The game does have decent balance between all the guns but I still don't like the cash shop system it has and you need to repair weapons.

I play a bunch of different games so I don't have the time to no life in this game for 7 or 14 days and grind. The best kevlar and helmet can only be bought for the co-op currency and only last 14 days. That system really sucks for me since if I buy something that last 14 days but I only play 7 days then I obviously lose on it. I am also not interested in the co-op part of the game.
The cash shop also seems to rotate a few weapons every 2 weeks that are only available for real money and only last 7 days.

The game has very small maps, granted some people might actually like that but I really hate these incredibly small maps where you can spawn and throw a grenade to the enemy spawn, it also just encourages a bunch of nade spamming and camping and spawn killing.

The dedicated / peer 2 peer / lobby server system is a good idea with potential but as it is right now after you play 1 map it takes forever for the next one to start on most servers because people always seem to leave and the host has to start each new match manually it seems but this could be cause the game is in beta. There are also always people that lag in every single match.

The games graphics are not that good on max settings. I know graphics are not everything but when they keep using it as a selling point and even on steam they keep bragging about cryteks cry engine" for example this is what it says under features of this game: "Expect the best – Crytek's trademark quality meets free-to-play gaming" You kinda expect them to deliver but they really don't

reviewText:
IntroThis is one of my favorite or favorite first person shooter of all time, you play as apart of the team of Warface a group that will stop at nothing to defeat the evil Blackwood forces(Or at least thats what I believe its about), there’s just so much to talk about hear so I'm going to talk about some Pros and Cons of this game

Pros- It's free - its a free-to-play game that is so worth getting
- Gameplay - the game has overall smooth gameplay with easy to learn controls
- Co-op Missions - I've previously had this game on Xbox and after all the time playing it I've almost never played Versus and mostly played Co-op missions, every day never Co-op missions drop 1 easy, 2 normal, 2 hard, and 1 extreme, to get to the next difficulty you have to beat the previous ones, you play with 4 other people taking on tons of the Blackwood forces in unique maps and have 1 or 2 bosses to deal with, mostly Heavy Gunners, but also Giant Mechs, what makes the Co-op the most fun is that everyone can't go one class and you have to work together with you different abilities to survive
- Special Operations - everyday you'll be awarded a curtain amount of operation coins that give you access to Cyber Zombies and more, adding this gives more variety to the game
- Unique Classes - this game has 4 unique classes for ever gamemode each with their own specials abilities and and unique loadouts, 1st you have the ammo man, equipped with a assault rifle, pistol, knife, grenades, and ammunition, which you can use to give your self and teammates more ammo, 2nd class and my personal favorite is the medic, instead of an assault rifle he comes equipped with a shotgun, and everything else except for the ammunition, he comes with a medic pack(to heal yourself and other) and defibrillator to revive dead players, the 3rd class is the Engineer, which comes with a SMG different knife and no pistol, but he comes with land mines, and Armor(to restore to teammates and your self), 4th and final class is the Sniper, comes with a Sniper and regular loadout, and nothing special
- SafeHouse - this is small feature you may not ever notice but once you do you'll be happy you did your hideout is basically your house with a training course and pool table, dart board, tv, and everything else a normal house would have
- No Glitches - game runs absolutely smooth, not a single crash or glitch I've experienced
- Versus - or multiplayer, is extremely balanced with lots maps and detail
- Graphics - game has great graphics that keep you in the moment
- No FPS Drops - in my playtime I've never had a drop of FPS and as I said runs smooth
- Soundtrack - the soundtrack for this game is amazing and will get your blood pumping

Cons- Limited Unlocks? - this is really stupid where you can rent weapons for a limited amount of time, or you can permanently buy it which is the obvious choice to make
- Kredits - these cost real money and are a lot of the currency for the game
- Crowns - WTF are these Crowns for, these things are extremely hard to get, if your lucky you can get about 8 per Co-op mission but to purchase anything with them you need like 900 but the biggest bs about this is that Crowns only buy timed items, meaning that you can buy a sexy orange gun with it but and only use it for a day before it disappears from your inventory so what's the ####### point of these then, it would make sense if you actually lets us buy permanent items with these
- Versus Needs More Game Modes - versus needs a lot more game modes as there are some but you need way more of a variety to keep you playing, though the game has a lot to offer so this isn't a big issue for me
- G-Face Account - I don't like the idea of having to make an account to play this game though most Free-To-Play games have this so I'll just deal with it so it's not that bad
There might be more issues with the game but as of now I haven't ran into any of them yet

Final VerdictThis game is amazing considering the pure fact thats its free and its hard finding negative reasons to give in the review and its hard to not get this game, my final verdict for this game is a 10/10 for Free-To-Play games its flat out amazing and even if it wasn't free i'd still buy it since its just so good, so stop what your doing and make sure to get this game right now before you regret it!!!!!!

reviewText:
Underwhelming.

After seeing this game advertised at several game expo's over the last 2 1/2 years, I will say that I'm not too impressed with how this game turned out.

I've played a few matches of this game at different game shows, like Euro gamer or Gamescon, however the game doesn't feel or look different to any other first person shooters out on the market.
It feels like Gotham City Impostors, Battlefield Play4Free, Allience of Viliant Arms or Arctic combat.

The aestetics and gameplay style of this game is typical of online multiplayer first person shooters aimed at the low budget market, even though there are better games on the market.
voteText: 817 of 1,105 people (74%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
I've put plenty of time and money into this game to get the whole experience.

PROS: Good co-op missions

TONS of generally speaking well designed pvp maps

Great animation quality

Great gear can generally be unlocked without spending a penny

Great visuals

Intuitive real time weapon customization

Good two player co-op interaction such as climbing assistance, picking up knocked down comrades, and the basic healing, armoring, and ammo filling mechanics

CONS: Every single game you play will be laggy, regardless of if it's co-op or pvp, regardless of where you live, and regardless of what your connection speed is

If your kd/r is above 1.5 you will be accused of hacking constantly, if it's above 2.0 you will be kicked from every pvp server you join

Unlocking the great gear I mentioned earlier will require between 300-600 hours of gameplay depending on skill level and what tier of gear suits you best

In general, gameplay is fairly limited in variety beyond run, point, click, kill

When you quick join a game chances are you will be limited to TDM on whatever map is at the top of the selection list at the time, typically meaning you will only be playing pvp on 1 map every time for a few weeks on end unless you want to use standard search and play with people who have sunk hundreds of hours in the game in Plant The Bomb.

If you want to get great kit of the start prepare to spend at least $100 to cover all 4 of your classes with a good gun and some boots, gloves, and body armor

Gunplay seems to lack knowledge of actual firearms. You will automatically charge your auto and semi-auto weapons everytime you reload, regardless of whether your bolt is locked to the rear or you're tac reloading. Recoil typically means your weapon will vibrate and your muzzle will float upwards at a constant rate. And the classic holographic and red dot sight faux pas of reticles being visible without actually ADS

Player movement feels sluggish and loose without the ability to make tight adjustments quickly

Many maps have issues with hitboxes overstretching their objects and creating invisible walls. This is especially noticeable when firing tight into cover.

reviewText:
Warface is a bad game.

Like most F2P games, you'll need to make an account. No big deal, just a hassle. You also will have to put up with Warface using its own independent launcher, which means it updates outside of Steam. When Marvel Heroes has shown that F2P games can update from the Steam platform with few headaches, it's hard to give launchers a pass anymore.

Anyways, the game proper is very fond of its status as a co-op focused FPS. And Warface is, in fact, a co-op focused FPS. On the surface, it looks like you have a great new game for you and your buddies. Each day, a new rotation of missions is put in play, requiring you to complete the lower tiers of dificulty before the harder missions become available. So you'll do some mindless shooting, then get down to more objective based missions, and then get your ♥♥♥ handed to you in the highest tier content. Fun, right? No. Not fun. Don't you ever make that mistake again.

The thing about this content climb" is that there's no matching progression on the player side. You'll easily complete those first two missions each day

reviewText:
So... my Warface review. Well, I'll start out by saying that I was part of the very early closed betas of warface, and played it almost daily starting around Febuary 2013 until about November 2013. I had a large group of friends I played with, and one by one they slowly stopped. Back then, it was pretty buggy and there were a lot of hackers, so once I saw that Warface was posted on Steam, I decided to give it a shot.

I really genuinely enjoyed playing Warface. Cumulative between betas, I invested about 250-400 hours. (All stats and time counters reset every time a new beta started, or large changes were made so it was hard to keep track.) It was a great free to play game with a lot of maps and options. Around this time one year ago, they implemented the kredit system, so people could invest real hard earned money for weapons, boxes, armor, etc. I, being very into the game spent about $200 (regretfully) over the course from October to November 2013. I was dead set on getting the PEG Bullpup shotgun. All $200 was spent, and I was left without the shotgun. A friend of mine rolled ONE box, and got it first try. I was furious. Ultimately, this is why I stopped playing almost a year ago.

Fast forward to when it posted on steam, I decided to reinstall the game and try again. Now, when it posted on Steam, you could use the actually gold currency to buy boxes. I still had about $800,000 from when I played, so I said screw it and tried for the PEG Bullpup again. (Kredits are the real money currency, and gold is acquired from PVP and PVE missions) If you have played Warface, you can understand JUST HOW MUCH $800,000 is. I used every freaking dollar and did not get the gun.

TL;DR The gameplay is great, if youre in a lobby with well rounded players or have some friends to play with. The pay-to-win factors kills any enjoyment of actually unlocking stuff.

I'll probably continue to play this game, and hate myself for doing so.

reviewText:
OVERVIEW

Warface is a first person shooter that mix PvP & Co-op element. It is developed by Crytek which they are known for their WOW graphics in their Crysis game. This game seem to take ideas of Call Of Duty military shooter,Battlefield class system mix with Crysis real-time weapon attachments. The question is. Is the game good enough or it just another generic shooter that we play over the past 10 years ?

GAMEPLAY : 7/10

When you start off the game,you are given to create your own soldier. Sadly all you do is just choose faces and all of them are generic looking. Before this game even come out on Steam,they removed a female characters due to controversy. Now all you get is just another every generic soldier with zero personality.

Here is the images of the female characters :
http://media.pcgamer.com/files/2013/10/warface_featured.jpg
http://s22.postimg.org/dkp34kx2p/warface.jpg
http://www.war-face.ru/sites/default/files/13/05/new-female-characters.jpg

You basically have 4 classess total to choose from and all of them play differently with each of them having their own pros & cons. The problem is that you need to play certain co-op mission to unlock the medic & engineer. Seriously ????

You able play either Co-op modes or PvP modes. The Co-op modes basically have seven mission. Even though certain mission offer different objectives,it pretty much barebone with no effort put into it and it hard to find match due to afk host. You could play with lesser player but you will die even more faster because of no backup. The Ai is simply a charging idiot and they don't take cover unless they are inside the building. The PvP modes offer six types of modes to choose from. Those six modes is nothing new and have been done to death in many first person shooter game.

Unlike certain games where you can charge and almost own most people,this game require teamwork especially you need somebody to help you climb a certain obstacle so that a plus.

GRAPHICS : 7/10

While the game looked quite good for some people,i expect it to be even more better considering it is built in CryEngine 3. However since it is a free 2 play games and many people with low specs PC wanted to try this,i let it slide.

The environment and texture details on some terrain,objects and weapon are neatly done. The character models is not what i expect to see in a CryEngine games but it acceptable nonetheless.

My only complaint is that like most shooter is the color settings. Most of the times i stare is puke brown environment which gives an impression that this game had a very dull feeling into it.

There is not much graphics settings you can fiddle around with. The interface is well done and doesn't block most of your view.

Certain animation that plays out are done badly as well as the ragdoll physic which felt stiff.

AUDIO : 7/10

While certain guns actually sound good and packed a punch,some of it just sound bad like an air gun or pee shooter.

As far as i know there is barely any ambience in the game which make the game feel lifeless.

Voice acting is pretty ok,nothing extraordinary but it good nonetheless.

LONG-LASTING APPEAL : 4/10

To be honest the game get extremely boring very fast. It bugs me why this game isn't in early access version since it lacked some content especially the shop.

PvP modes is extremely generic and co-op modes that only offer short lasting fun.

FINAL VERDICT : 6.3/10

It up to you whether you want to try this game out but i wouldn't recommend this game at it current state despite it acceptable scores. The whole game just felt lacking in content and it need some polish. It still p-i-sses me off that they remove the female character in favor of making a generic male characters. Not to mentioned the game is pay 2 win too so yeah you might want to avoid this game.

GRADE : D ( Not Bad )

I love this game but I’m giving it a negative review… why? It’s full of hackers.

Crytek use Fairfight to try and stop them and they have built a report feature into the game but when you report a cheat nothing seems to happen.  For every hacker that’s banned several more seem to appear.  This leads to lack of trust amongst honest players and genuinely good players being accused of hacking all the time. Often it’s hard to have any trust that the person who won the round did it fairly, there’s so many hackers who knows.

The gameplay is fantastic and very addictive, the weapons feel great to use, loads of good upgrades, it’s certainly a great game but expect to see plenty of cheaters – For me this outweighs all the good aspects it’s a thumbs down unfortunatly.

reviewText:
I have a mixed opinion about the game. While it can be a fun enough game, there's a fair amount of cons that ruin the fun. I do and don't recommend this game, and here's why :

Pros :
-Guns don't completely overpower one another
-The game keeps you going by having to unlock things
-Most Co-Op missions are swapped out daily
-Fair amount of upgrades for your character
-Co-Op requires a good amount of teamwork
*This also means that the team has to consist of at least 3 of the 4 classes with a team of 3^, if you want to be successful
-Easy-to-use controls
-Actions are easy to do and are beneficial

Cons :
-Co-Op isn't that great, gets boring after the first few co-op missions
*The game requires players to play Co-Op to unlock some new gear
-Most weapons require real money to keep permanently, instead of 1, 7, or 30 days
-PvP isn't very fun after a while due to various reasons:
*People dropshot too often
*Spawn camping is insane
*Medics serve little purpose in PvP since you can respawn right after death
*Maps are incredibly small, disabling a need for any tactical play
*Snipers are rendered useless on almost every map, due to the small map size
-Co-Op gets to be a bit repetitive
-Great weapons are cheap, allowing new players to get an amazing weapon
*This is both a pro and a con, but listed under con because it takes away some of the purpose of Co-Op
-Medic is used more for close quarters rather than reviving teammates
*The medics are equipped with a shotgun, while other classes aren't

Overall, I would recommend this game to anybody who's played Fps's (First-Person-Shooters) such as CoD when it was good (Before MW3 in my opinion), Battlefield, and Rainbow Six. Don't expect the game to be amazing, for me it's more a game to play when I'm bored with nothing else to do.

Reminds me of that one f2p Combat Arms, or even AvA. . Moving on to the co-op. The co-op is so painfully generic and is still probably more fun than playing pvp because of no overpowered opponents. You can also potentially grind the co-op missions against AI to earn currency that buys you weapons and gear that could even aid you in pvp. The game is only a 3gb install, so if you are that desperate give it a try, and maybe play 2 or 3 matches and judge it for yourself. I really want to love this game, but mentioned cons are really pain in the gluteus. I will edit this review if I notice anything has changed, until then happy gaming.

reviewText:
The graphics in the game are very good and even when you run it on the highest settings, it runs smoothly.
The controls are easy and just like any other game.
The weapons are ok but the power and accuracy are sometimes a bit strange.
The game is free to play but everything is based on forcing the player to buy items in order to be able to play the game properly. Even if you buy certain items you'll notice soon enough that you'll also lose alot of Warface dollars with each repair of your purchased item. Each map you play will cost you a certain amount of Warface dollars just because of the repair they charge you. The more expensive your purchased items are, the higher the price will be for the repair.
So, the more you play, the more money you'll lose unless you don't use your pruchased items.
The only way to be able to play the game properly is to buy alot of kredits (which again cost alot of REAL money!!!) and once you've done that you'll see that the game is a bottomless pit. Even if you'd buy 12,000 kredits (which is € 99.99), you'll end up buying kredits again if you wanna keep on playing the game the way you like it.
The game itself is very good but the fact that it is only based on dragging money out of your pocket makes it a game I really do NOT recommend. The more you play, the more repairs you'll have. The more expensive items you've purchased, the more money you'll lose due to each repair.
To be able to play properly against powerful enemies" you need to unlock certain weapons and items and for that you need kredits. Kredits can only be purchased with REAL MONEY!
Because of the "repair of each purchased item" and the whole "item rental" idea you'll always end up losing money and crowns. SO THINK MORE THAN TWICE BEFORE YOU START SPENDING MONEY ON AND IN THIS GAME!!!
The weapons in de dlcs are inferior to those you need to unlock which ultimately can be done by spending money... AGAIN!
Another downside in this game is the very high number of hackers and cheaters which is I guess because the game is free. And as a matter of fact playing against these hackers and cheaters will only cost you your hard earned Warface dollars and crowns because of the repairs you have to pay each time you play a map. The repairs are only for the purchased items
date: so if you don't wanna have any repairs
recommended: you need to play with the default equipment.\nThe players you have been playing with recently aren't visible in steam either
hoursPlayed:
which is also very strange. In fact unlike other games only a few things about this game are visible in steam.
Friends cannot be invited to the game through steam and your friends also need to have at least rank 9 in Warface to join you in a PvP game. The last is to prevent the noobs from being butchered by the pros but it also makes playing with your friends in a private room impossible unless they ranked up enough.

Nowadays "free" games take more money out of your pocket than a game you have to pay for..."

reviewText:
I'm going to start this off by saying that this game USED to be fun, it used to be enjoyable and playable, playing against your own rank and with guns that were relatively the same as everyone else's. But all of that has changed. They made the game even laggier than it already was for low ended PC's, they made it even more pay to win than it already was and even more BUGGIER than it already was.

The Bad
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The hit detection is horrible, sliding messes it up and causes a massive confusion among players as to why they won't die. Head glitching, is a major issue among snipers, as only snipers can kill the snipers due to the innacuracy of most weapons. I can get an 8 kill streak by spraying with an assault rifle, and get taken out by someone sliding. This is when you know that not much skill is taking place in a game.

The game is more pay to win than ever, I might as well say pay to get anything past the starter weapons. I personally just launch a game, go in and kill people, and with weapons that cost money, this is impossible. I can be top of a team, as an entirely f2p player, just to have the match end, and my gun repair costs being more expensive than my income from the match. I ACTUALLY LOSE MONEY FOR DOING GOOD.

The community is terrible, occasionally you may run into the scum of the world which I don't even have to describe, if you can name it, you can find it. I can tell my team to heal me, give me ammo, give me armor, and no one will even respond. All everyone cares about is taking as many kills as possible... Not the Objective... Not the teamplay... Not even the sanity of others.

The game is way too fast paced. Grenades are thrown halfway across the map, while running and jumping. Explosions all around and no way to escape the death that is about to turn a corner and murder you. If you have a lower ended PC, you can't even catch up in fps before you're dead. Yeah sure, you have a lot of health, but what is it worth when that person turning a corner has a 1 shot shotgun?

The developers are greedy. Never once have I seen an update for this game, and liked it. I played this game a year ago, and there wasn't half as many purchasable items as there is now. Their updates never fix anything, resolve issues the community has with the game or even helps the people who are actually good at fps, be anywhere close to being good at this game.

You need a separate account from steam, to play this game. I see several problems with this.

1. Hackers can just create a new account with a new email, and get right back to it.
2. Anyone that plays with higher ranking people will just create a new account, and start killing fresh noobs.
3. It requires a 2 step process, to get into a horrible game.

The game is slow in every aspect. If you want to join a server, you'll have to wait 3 minutes for the game to find you a lobby, then when the game launches, another 2 minutes for everyone to load up. When you get to the end of a game, you get a nice pointless cutscene pointing to a team, which then takes another 2 minutes to load back into the lobby. I probably spent more time loading than I did playing.


The Good
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I was able to uninstall quickly.

Overall Review
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This game is broken, those playing might not be aware of it but it is. Do not get this game if you have a slow PC, are easily angered or just downright hate the idea of a fast paced shotgun spraying game filled with kids.

reviewText:
My Background in other FPS games (context): 1,500 hours in CSGO. Thousands of hours in the Battlefield franchise. A few hundred hours in Call of Duty games.

Maps and Game Play: The Warface maps are small--smaller even than Counter Strike, which is criticized for small maps. I'm not impressed with the Warface maps. They don't lend themselves to holding angles like CSGO. They aren't big like Battlefield. They aren't even tactically as good as COD. I struggle to understand the map design. They don't promote skill based play.

So if we're not holding angles and have precision based shooting like CSGO. And we're not dealing with a larger, tactical map like Battlefield. What are we doing in Warface?

You can do these unrealistic, arcade style slides? 9 times out of 10, I easily kill the arcade slider in close combat.

The other terrible game mechanic is toggling rapidly between laying prone and standing up. You can switch so fast that it looks like a  supernatural zombie. In medium to close combat, expect the prone toggler but its not that hard to spray them down.

I enjoyed playing the game, but the maps and gameplay options just get old. The prone toggling and arcade sliding, while fun at first, don't lend themselves to long term game play.

Pay to Play or Win: You can pay for better weapons. Some claim you can get these weapons for free by grinding XP. Yes, you can.

But you can't afford to use them afterwards! Try using some of the best weapons, armor, boots, etc in the game. You will pay HUGE repair costs after each mission. You will pay more for the repair costs than you made on the mission. Forget pay to win. It's pay to play.

Think about it. It's a free game. Repair costs are there to force you to pay to use the weapon. The whole game mechanic is designed to force you to spend money (or the game can't exist). Or not be able to use the weapons you either purchased or unlocked through grinding levels and XP.

Hacks: If you have played other FPS games, you know there will always be hacks. Rather than a real anti-cheat that detects when the game's memory has been compromised, they opted for Fair Fight. Fair Fight is a performance based anti-cheat, where if you play substantially better suddenly you can be banned. There's other factors as well.

The problem is hack sites that sell wallhacks and aimbots also provide guides for getting around Fair Fight. A lot of it is common sense about doing better slowly, not following people through walls, not following people who can't see you, etc.

I've seen more wallhacks in Warface than I saw in CSGO, Battlefield, and COD combined. It's infested. There's even people in game advertising hack sites. It's easy (but not always reliable) to scream aimbot in any game. The truth is, any aimbot shot COULD have been made by a skilled player. It's easier for me to spot a wallhacker and in Warface, there's always going people who ALWAYS know where everyone is.

I have seen dozens of people Fair Fight banned. I just think with the guides out there for getting around Fair Fight, many are getting around it.

Develop a real anti-cheat that detects when the game has been hooked.

Summary: If you want a Battlefield type of game, with super small maps, less tactical options, and prone togglers, then play this game.

If you get beat in other FPS games, just spend money on this game. You can buy super fast boots that make you run much faster. You can buy health regenerating vests that will take you from near death to 100%. You dream it--you can buy it. And maybe even win, assuming you find a game without a wall hacker. ;)

reviewText:
Warface, the first experience of Crytek in the free-to-play field, is a very nice competitive online FPS, with a lot of well-known game modes and fast gameplay. The visuals are pure Crytek quality, and even if it’s not an original game, it surely deserves a deep look.

Definitely the best free to play game of 2015. It was pay to win last year (2014) but Crytek took feedback and changed the economy system. So now every weapon in game can be bought with in game currency. I think its a great approach and i think Warface is heading in the right direction.

Also its free to play so you should check it out!

reviewText:
Vs games are small uninspired maps.. Not much room if at all for any kind of real strategy. Pretty much run, gun, lob grenades because no more than a quick sprint from the spawn point and you're at a choke point already.

Co-Op is boring.. Just running through a map picking off AI along the way to reach a helicopter extraction. No actual things to do along the way. The AI is dumber than dumb though and you can pretty much sum up Co-Op as target practice.. There was never a challenge.

Graphics: Forget this has the name Crytek attached to it. This looks like a throw away game developed for the Wii-U

I know this is Free To Play... But.. The game is completely uninspiring, ugly looking and boring.. I wouldn't even think of spending a dime in the game store for credits for perks etc.. The game doesn't do enough to warrant making purchases.

reviewText:
OUTDATED:

As I was looking through the reviews of this game I noticed that all of the most helpful ones were negative, I couldn't believe this as I have been playing this game for about a month now and am having a great time.  I decided to write this review and come up with a counter argument for each of the most popular criticisms.

Pay to win" Its F2P what do you expect?  They do need to make money!  Its actually much less P2W then other games I've played.  The P2W part is that you can use real money to buy "Kredits" which you can use to buy in game items xp boosts and revive coins
date: I'm going to address each of these seperatly.\n\nWeapons: Most of the weapons you can buy with Kredits you can also buy with in game money and only last a certain amount of time therefor making it under powered.  Even if you can't buy it with in game money you can usually find a gun almost equal to it and buy that
recommended: even if you had all the best items in the game a guy who just started playing could beat you
hoursPlayed: its more about skill than anything else.\n\nXP Boosts: Pretty much what it sounds like
voteText: you get x amount of xp toward the next rank for completing a lvl and an xp boost increases the mount for a bit
helpfulPercent: not not necesary not OP not a problem.\n\nRevive Coins: The most P2W item in the game
votesHelpful: basicly you use revive coins when you die (ONLY in PVE not PVP) to come back to life
votesTotal: you have a limit of 3 per lvl
votesFunny: kinda P2W'ish but not horrible
commentsCount: you can choose to buy them or not you can have fun either way.\n\nMy final point is that its free

reviewText:
Let me start by saying this is my own stupid fault for listening to my friend and skipping the tutorial, as I assume there might have been some information in there to help me understand the game a bit better. Also, I'm not sure how P2W comes into play during the game, but I didn't explore much.

I only managed to squeeze out three matches before I ragequit. One co-op and two PVP, FFA and capture the point(? didn't catch the name).

The co-op was just a wreck. My friend and I drop right into the action, this is great, I kill around 10 enemies before I start running out of ammo, as does he. I see the yellow ammo icon above his head and with my deductive and reasoning skills, I figure that means I'm some type of ammo bearer and I need to replenish his ammo, either that or they're just saying he's low on ammo. I'm pressing buttons, going close to him and pressing 'E', nothing works. So I assume our ammo refills after a wave and continue playing. He dies, and I use my final clip to eliminate the enemy in front of him and run over to help. From my Call of Duty co-op skillz, I assume all I have to do is run over to him and press 'E' and my character will pull out some small thing, stab him in the face with it and he'll be all better....it doesn't happen. I'm smashing 'E' all around to no avail, then he says 'There should be a message that says Press E to revive', but I didn't see that. Then I take on about three other enemies with a pistol and finally die. This was all within 2-3 minutes of the mission, we hadn't even moved out of that grove yet. That's a good introduction to the game, even though I'm aware that I did NOT complete the tutorial, where are all the tooltips?

Well, we decided to join a PvP match next. As a decent CoD player, I'm quickly getting excited as I plan to do well with the first gun at least. We join a FFA already in progress and I'm introduced to this incredibly frame stuttering. Every few seconds, whenever I pull a grenade, if someone comes into my screen, what's going on? I manage to pull through, though. What really irked me was the size of this map, I failed to get the name but it seemed to be a really small village with corners EVERYWHERE. I couldn't even count to 5 before someone spawned out of the area I JUST spawned from and unloaded a shotgun into my back. I finished at around 12/12, but didn't let that discourage me, as the next game would surely be better since I would be starting along with everyone else at the same time.

So back on the menu, I hit ready and await the game to start. I sit there for about 1 minute before I notice it says everyone else is already in game and I'm just ready. I see a green message on top telling me I'm connecting, but nothing's happening. So I try to quit, but there's no clickable back button or X button, so I have to ALT-F4 the game.

I quickly rejoin my friends game and at this time, we're playing some type of capture the three points in succession game. Which, at first, was going fine. Then I had a sudden lag spike. I hope in the future this game handles lag a bit better than just continuing my character's motions. I somehow managed to run all the way into enemy territory even though I wasn't pressing anything. But it was temporary and went away after that one death.

I can't remember any landmarks from the map other than this Chinese circle area on the final area capture. This map did seem to suffer from the same issues of the previous map, it's too small. You can barely (if you can) hear foot steps, so you don't know where the enemy is coming from. I don't like that your character has to vault over objects in a cinematic way, it's not a movie. I also can not stand this stuttering, seriously what is going on? I'm getting around 80-90FPS.

Anyway, most of these issues are just specific to me, I'm sure most other people don't have stuttering issues and have played through the tutorial...and have not gotten their game stuck in the lobby screen. But I'm notorious for having issues with games other people love. I wouldn't play it again, but maybe you may like it, give it a go, it's free.

reviewText:
Is this a good game? Yes, its in the Top 10 FPS F2P games.
Is it fun to play with friends? Yes, it offers a pretty good co-op mode that is fun and enjoyable.
Is the multiplayer fun to play? No, at level 8 you get thrown in with P2W users who judge your every move.
Is the Commmunity good or bad? Some people are good, but a majority of the people are bad.
Are there microtransactions? Yes, but weapons, helmets, and vests do have a permanent option. So, theres that.
Do people actually fight on the battlefield instead of camping in a corner? Uhhh........
Do people use cover when fighting? Errrr.....if you call spamming the slide button using cover
Are any of the classes OP? Hrm.....


EDIT: 7/22/15
The nail has now been hammered into the coffin. The fun co-op I talked about? Yeah, the community ruined that too. I just got off a Co-op mission with a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ medic, here. see for yourself:
Medic: Kill with knife
Me: Why?
Medic: Kill with knife and get heals
Me: What if i die tying to kill an enemy with a knife?
Medic: Then you're a ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥♥♥
Me: Whoa, no need to go there buddy
Medic: Go eat ♥♥♥♥ and die CoD Fanboy
Me: What did i do to deserve your hate?
Medic: ♥♥♥♥ off
Me: Are you going to answer the question?
Medic: ♥♥♥♥ off

Conclusion: A good, F2P game ruined by a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ community. Don't even waste your time or hard drive space with this game. The second you see it, run. Do not not look back, just run.

reviewText: Warface is a free to play FPS game. The game itself as a whole is good,However there is pay to win aspect to it. This does get to you at times. For example.. Its quiet frustrating when players are buying guns/armour among other things which other players without paying for cannot get. You can't simply get them by just levelling up,giving them a noticeable advantage over others. But that aside the player models and skins are really good along with the weapon sounds. The gunplay I think is very responsive and feels well balanced.The maps and layouts are also very good. It has a nice feel to the game. For me its the best free FPS game that i have played. I would give it a 7 out of 10. If there was no pay to win implemented I would say higher but it is there so its a 7 ... That's my review..Its my first one so don't hate :)

reviewText:
Pros:
-Confortable game speed, coming with swift sliding
-Detailed graphic and good sound effect
-Well-balanced weaponry... uh, at least no Pay2Win thingy
-MINE KILL FTW (I love being the engineer so much.)
-Free to play, easy to pick

Cons:
-Awful chat... just awful...
-Too high cost for every single equip
-Nonfunctional rank system (After rank 13 we have to join matches with RANK 80 BEASTS. It would be great if we have regulated matches based on K/D ratio or something.)
-No Asian server (I truly have a strong wish that we have JPN server for this good game.)

I mainly play PvP and some say it's nothing but camping and spawnkilling. Still, sometimes we have good, intense matches. Though this game have quite a few flaws to fix, I believe Warface is one of the best free to play FPS on Steam.

reviewText:
Don't care about PVP, but I personally don't really like the co-op.  It just doesn't engage me. Maybe it's just the fact that my teammates are all snipers. Maybe it's because I'm the one that always gets smacked and killed by a shield. Maybe it's that teammates half the time don't care that I get hit by the shield, and just watch as I die. Co-op sucks, unless you have good friends to play it with.

Not to mention the shop system isn't that good either. Wait, so you buy a gun permanently, but you have to REPAIR it for use? Why not just rent it, then, since you're going to be spending money to use it anyway! (I hate rental systems, but the repair system seems just as bad to me.)

If you didn't read my little rant, the game is little more than an irritation to me. I wouldn't seriously recommend the game.

5/10, not bad ideas, but not very enjoyable.

Edit: Even if the game has been changed in updates, I don't plan to return to it. Like I said, I don't care about the pvp, and the issue with co-op was usually the community. Doesn't seem like it's worth trying again.

The game isn't bad, gameplay wise. It's probably the best out of every shooter i played.

Good:
There is somth about it that's so satisfying, it's like all shooter combined in one game made in the best way possible. It's a twitch shooter, but it is also very tactical, which i absolutely love. It's this mix that makes it special. I love being able to shoot-and-run-instant-respawn in a small map, but also have the option to use tactics, such as placing a claymore at a choke point or at a hallway to prevent enemy from coming at you, healing after i get shot, picking the best spot, and shooting other people from behind while sneaking in order to minimize death count, with a silenced smg. I have not experienced this in other games. I play COD CS:GO BF4,3 Hardline beta etc. (your prolly thinking hey that's in every shooter ever made, dud,  but it was way more usable and satisfying. It has more substance if u know what i mean. It's just the way i feel i guess)

Real time switching of accessories is amazing. Say i have an assault rifle and have 3 different optics to chose from long range to short range and you can switch between them depending where your enemy is at, Crysis style. This game will satisfy your uniqe weapon accessory itch, as it has meny of them.

Guns have a great feel and weight to them, nice sound, and that woosh ffffsssss from a high rpm silenced smg never gets old. Great graphics and sound for a fast paced shooter. The ce engine holds up nicely. No complains. I did have a glitches with my graphics, but switched the drivers to stable release and went away (amd r9 280x 14.4) <- if u get glitch switch to stable driver 14.4

CONTROLS ARE AMAZING. They completely nailed the controls. I mean the way you move around and mouse movement. It doesn't have any weight.. if u know what i mean, like in bf3,4.. the difference is huge and what kept me playing untill:

Bad:
The F2P model is not good at all, and certain items you get make the game so unbalanced, it just doesn't make sense.

After i reached a certain rank, i could not play in the rookie" channel anymore(where there are servers made by new ppl). I am forced to play with the "Pro" chanel. Where basically ... you got it.. i'ts channel where the top players play. They have all the cool ♥♥♥♥ you can think of. from bullet proof vest that take 3 magazine to kill and can resist grenades and claymores (all exploding same time). to automatic shotguns
recommended: etc.\n\nThe player count is too low. I mean
hoursPlayed: you will not be used to this. I doub't there are even 100 people playing. That's like a server in some other games lol.  There are three channels Rookie Experienced and Pro. After you done with rookie
voteText: you go straight to pro because there are 0 people playing in Experienced (which would have been the second step for me).\n\nThe difference is that in rookie channels
helpfulPercent: all the people there are new or trying out the game. They will be very bad at playing and certainly do not have the best gear(they don't care enought to buy weapons) and when you go to Pro channel
votesHelpful: all the poeple playing are very serious about the game and have cool gear
votesTotal: which they bought or unlocked. I am not trying to blame on P2W model
votesFunny:
but these "two groups" of players are extremely different.

After u done with rookie best thing to do is open a new account and start playing rookie again...

When i was playing in rookie I was thinking

I'll keep an eye on this..."

reviewText:
Alright soo most people say that this game is pay to win or you have to grind the game to get stuff on my opinion thats not true i have 72 hours on the game and i never had to grind the game sure maybe this day i wont have mucht money to buy what i whant but maybe the next day i will .
Warface is a co-op game and also pvp I has several game modes for pvp Team deathmacht , storm , Plant the bomb , Capture , and you get daily co-op missions and if you complete thos missions you get crowns now i wont get to mucht detail about the crowns but basically if you complete a mission you will get a kill points score and the time that you got on that mission and depending how well your team did you get different reward.
Co-op is a great part of the game thats what i mostly play on this game its great with friends and then you got thos interactions with players that you never see on other games even battlefield for example sliding now sliding can sometimes get annoying because its hard to hit them sometimes but its also fun and then you got the climbing on this theres certain areas you can achive by you and friend helping each other up ther you can decide just to boost your friend and stay down ther or you can both go up .
Finaly you got special operations i  havent tried yet i only did cyber horde and its awsome really hope to see more content for that but other special operations are Tower raid and Operation: Cold peak .
But no game is perfect sometimes you get small lag issues or it takes some time to load the game or the round and then you will hear the usual people complaning about shotguns ( shotguns are not op dont worry ) and camping and yada .
But overrall i really love this game its great i ain´t mucht of a pvp i mostly play about 4 to 5 rounds of pvp then like the 6 co-op missions.
About hackers its not  full of hacker Crytec got the fairfight system now the game is more clean . Overall i give this game about an 9/10 i really recomend play this game.

reviewText:
This game is really bad. Like really.

The graphics are allright I guess, not bad, but not great either. It's pretty well optimized as well. Runs pretty smooth. It says that it uses PhysX in the options menu, which seems to be completelty false.

And oh yea, the bugs. Oh man, the bugs. First of all, grahpical glitches. Started tha game the first time and created a character and it doesn't even look roght. And you can only be female if you were in the closed beta. What's up with that? Also a lot of people are having problems with the mouse, including me. It slows down and speeds up randomly. It's really annoying and makes it hard to aim.

Almost forgot, It's an pay 2 win even when you play co-op. Pay to revive? Check. Rare to get ammo and start off with very limited ammo? Check.

Better than CoD: Ghosts? Probably not, but it's pretty bad.

For me, it gets an 2/10. Could have been good, but they screwed it up really bad.

reviewText:
This game has potential but there are A LOT of flaws.

1. When I move my mouse upwards, my crosshair doesn't give a ♥♥♥♥ and stays on the exact spot it was before. Aiming for the heads (or aiming in general) is impossible. Fyi, I played with a sensitivity of 100 and DPI of 3200. And yes, this is only with Warface, not with others.
2. The buy system is broken. I couldn't kill someone with a headshot by a sniper because he overpayed to put a metal bucket on his head that magically makes your sniper shoot potatoes or something.
3. It's not easy to see whether the weapon you're buying is permanent or for 1 day use only.
4. Visibility needs work.
5. I don't want a woman yelling in my ear that we lost an objective every second when playing Domination.
6. I don't want to get matched up against people that are 50 levels higher and spent real currency to buy overpowered shotguns to one shot me.
7. I don't want to get matched up against people from the other side of the world with internet speeds of 1 kb/s. Seriously. Make regional servers or something. When playing with 12 guys there are max 2 with at least 3 bars of connection speed (including me). Set a ping limit. Just do something. One time I was shooting this guy in front of me, and then he literally just vanished and appeared behind me and shot me in the back. This happens too often.
8. Sliding is OP, I think it has something to do with the hitboxes or with the addicts and their OP weapons but as soon as someone slides you know you're dead.
9. The weapons you begin with are terrible. The sniper wouldn't be able to hit the broad side of a barn when standing a meter away from it.
10. The crosshairs. I understand there is some sort of futuristic or sci-fi-ish theme to this game but I rather have a small × in my screen.
11. Once again, the begin sniper is awful. When not scoped in it takes up roughly 60% of your whole screen. Am I supposed to walk through the map scoping in or something?
12. Grenades deal far too much damage.

I really wish this stuff was fixed because as I said, there's potential. But I refuse to play a PvP FPS when I can't even aim and I get matched up with people with pings of over 9000.
voteText: 13 of 21 people (62%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText: Played for an hour, can't take anymore. It's so boring. I don't think I'm being too critical about f2p shooters. I played and enjoyed other f2p shooters like Hawken, and ghost recon online. They have some type of personality. This game though, is just devoid of soul. I don't know what it is. Could be the mute/lackluster sounds, the overly generic graphics, or just a non-vocal community (ingame) but I feel like sleeping when I play this. Not to add that it seems to have a very heavy P2W model. Back to CSGO where every game has some excitement and thrill. Maybe it just needs guns skins ;). I hope the developers add some type of spice to this game.

reviewText:
It's not a terrible game by any means, it's quite fun at times, and some of the modes are quite fun like Capture and Storm. However the cons cancel out the pros and then some in my opinion.

Pros:

Lots of maps

Most maps are well designed

Classes are balanced

Runs great (was staying above 100fps maxed out on my mid-range rig)

Quite a lot of modes

A few colorful maps that come as a surprise (the Brazil map is beautiful)

The hub is well done and clean (I really like how you add on attachments)

Slide function is really fun and fluid

Some team work aspects are cool, like helping one another to reach places.

Free

Not a big download


Cons:

Some maps are copied and pasted

it will cost you OVER $400 to purchase all the permanent gear and weapons

Visuals are sub-par for a Crytek game

Hit detection is pretty awful

Several modes are just poorly executed compared to other games

Options menu is lacking FoV and other things

No way to search for servers via Ping

Tutorial is awful, and leaves a lot unexplained. (it gets explained later when you unlock more classes, but stuff like weapon melee, sliding, and other basic mechanics should be explained in the FIRST tutorial not later)

Suffers from the same thing that BF4 does where some icons like revive and where the bomb is are just WAY too big.

Pay2win in the sense that you can buy objectively superior gear, however you do have to work to unlock it so it's pretty
balanced at first.

NEWB CHANNELS ARE NOT RANK CAPPED!!!! This results in experienced players coming in and making the game extremely unfun for new players.


Overall the game's cons out weigh the pros so I have to unrecommend, however it is worth a shot right now since as mentioned it's not a big download and as of now since everyone is new it's pretty balanced, however I don't see this game having a long life span unless they fix the hit detection and server searching. It is still in beta so I can hope for sever improvements (it happened in BF4 8 MONTHS after release, so there's definitely hope!)

reviewText:
Red Ping / ESP Hackers
So, in this WONDERFUL game, there is ABSOLUTELY no way to tell the difference between someone with crap connection to these crap servers, and someone who is using a ESP / Wallhack.

I realize that as a general rule, game developers don't really give a f about feedback from the community, but when you make a game that is POSITIVELY BALANCED by someone getting a CHEAT / HACK for your game to play competitively... then your game is broken. The developers can ignore this if they choose, but I will not be investing any more money into this game until it is fixed. It's not that hard, if other games can do it, so can this one.

All it takes is developers that are as invested in the future of their game as they were in the beginning of it...

reviewText:
Warface...where do I even start with this game? Okay, well just to show that I'm not just some new player crying about being beaten. I would like to start by saying I beta tested this game on my Xbox 360 and back then it was so-so, more good than bad really. Then I come to play it on PC and at first it wasn't so bad. But honestly after awhile the Pay to Win" and the Hackers get to be too much.

In one game I was shooting a guy in the back and he magically killed me with his GUN without even turning around to look at me. Not to mention his gun was killing almost everyone in one hit.

I've had people survive shotgun blasts even though the shotgun was pretty much in their gut. I'm sorry
date:
no amount of body armor is going to stop a shotgun from splattering your spine against a wall when it's directly pointed against you.

Your shot patterns quickly become unrealisticly inaccurate during substained fire. I know accuracy goes way down the longer you hold down the trigger. But when you start watching your shots outline enemy targets who you have your crosshairs directly on and isn't anymore than 40 meters at the absolute most. It's a pretty good sign that there is a problem.

Spawn Camping is a regular thing in these games. There is nothing stopping anyone from coming into your spawn and killing you without giving you a fighting chance. I'm shocked I haven't seen a whole team get locked down by just explosives alone. Seriously
recommended: whose bright idea was it to allow players to enter the enemy spawn and kill them without mercy? Sorry
hoursPlayed:
I like a hardcore shooter as much as the next person. But I do not like hardcore BS shooters...

I'm not even going to cover the other issues I have with this game.

In the words of one review on this game - It's a great game to uninstall."

reviewText:
After reading a lot of reviews i decided i would have a look at the game to see if it really is as bad as people say.

After getting instantly spawnkilled by a russian hacker with a .50 sniper, i had enough gameplay for a year of that game.

The shop couldn't be that bad right?

It wasn't that bad indeed. I saw a lot of nice, permanent, guns for a good price of something like $3700.

Knowing i already got $3000 for completing the turtorial, i decided to try and finish a game.

After 10 minutes of trying to find a game without spawnkilling, hacking russians, i found a nice game.

I did fairly well actually. I got 20 kills and died 5 times (i'm not new to fps game you know).

Thinking i would have a new gun in no-time, i was excited to see how much money i would get from a pretty good match.

$44.

44 ♥♥♥♥ing dollars for being good at the game.

If you are not good at the game but have a huge wallet you will be rewarded with a truck load of money and a high-five of the developer saying: ''You done did good kid.''

The developers don't give a ♥♥♥♥ about how much skill you have. They only give a ♥♥♥♥ about how much money you have.

That .50 sniper that the russian guy had you say? You can't even get that ♥♥♥♥ for in-game money. Not even for 1 day. And the only stat that is worse on it, when you compare it with your stock sniper rifle, is the magazine size (from 10 to 6).

Oh. And did i mention the bulletproof vests already? I was sneaking up to a guy and emptied half my magazine into his ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ only to have him turn around VERY SLOWLY and 3-shot me.

AND THAT'S NOT EVEN THE WORST PART!!!

THE WORST PART IS ♥♥♥♥ING SLIDING!!!

I'm not even going to tell you about that. Just read every single other review that mentioned it.

Also, your soldier walks about as fast as a crippled turtle.



It's true what they say guys. Stay away from it.

2/10

reviewText:
Horrible game. I take any good things i've said since the negative sides easily overcome the few possitive

-Pay To Win (Not just weapons but armor that removes 1 hit Headshots removing the sense of skill already)

PROS:

-Graphically good looking but nothing really spectacular. Nothing even close to Crysis 3 or 2.
-Gface is no longer a launch site (Like battlelog for example) and its just a launcher

Try it but don't expect much.

reviewText:
GAME OVERVIEW NOTES:
Free To Play.
Not pay to win but pay to unlock early.
Coop (PvE) is the fastest way to unlock items and gain Warface Dollars, Crowns, XP, Vendor XP
PvP is not recommended for XP grinding.
Gear makes a big difference including weapons. (YES, THE GAME IS GEAR BASED)
Weapons and Gear are either rental or permanent.
Weapons and Gear that are no longer in the game can still be used if a permanant version was obtained before the items were removed.

Game Modes:
Team Death Match - 8v8
Free For All - 16 total
Storm - Team A defends a point that Team B is trying to capture. Capturing a point grants access to the next point. 3 points total to win.
Capture - Team A defends a warhead briefcase that Team B needs to steal and bring back to base.
Plant the bomb - just like all plant bomb games and Counter Strike
Destruction - Both teams fight for a capture point in order to launch missles on the opposing enemy force. 3 missles launched wins the match.

Currency:
Kredits - premium cash bought with real money purchase (unlocks anything in the game)
Crowns - PvE coop currency that is used on the BEST items in the game. (Major League Gaming can restrict Crown gear)
Warface Dollars - basic cash used to repair and buy items that are unlocked (obtained after matches in pvp and in pve)

Vendor Unlocks: (each type of unlock is chosen before starting a match, and XP per type is not shared)
Gear (Outfit) - Boots, Gloves, Helm, Chest
Equipment (weapon attachements) - Scopes, Holograhpic sights, front grips, bipods, bayonetts, supressors and silencers
Weapon - Pistols, SMGS, MGS, Assault Rifles, Sniper Rifles, Knifes

Gear Grades:
Common -> Rare -> Ultra Rare (ultra rare being the best to unlock) -> Crown
Crown Gear will always beat all, for they provide armor and health regeneration, delaying of claymores, fast reload and weapon swap, or even granting immunity to 1 headshot)

reviewText:
It's not as bad of a game as people say.

PROS:
-Good graphics for a free to play game, mostly realistic gameplay ( *AHEM* except the break dancing insta prone.)
-Enjoyable level system, pretty good PVP/PVE
-Competative, satisfying, in terms of gameplay
-Not as pay-2-win as other free-to-play games. Guns bought with real world money don't have any significant advantage over their normal counterparts.
CONS:
-Broken matching system. Groups you based on rank, and not on skill.
-Broken progression system. Weapons take forever to unlock and it's extremely hard to get an upper hand against enemies with better weapons.
-Net code issue. If you thought BF4 was bad in terms of net code, I highly suggest you don't play this.

Other than that, this is a fine game.
7.2/10
voteText: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Crytek now brings us Warface, a F2P FPS.
So how is it?

After spending more than 10 hours while Warface wasn't on Steam, it is still a fun experience.
There is the standard multiplayer mode, which I'm sure all FPS fans are familiar with.
Then, there's the co-op mode encourages teamwork and you get more XP too. I would say co-op is where the game shines. Even while playing with random people, players are still being kind to one another and players are helping the inexperienced players.
Overall, I had a great time with the co-op gameplay.

There are 4 classes you can play as, as you progress through the co=op missions:
The Assault, who can give ammo to teammates.
The Medic, who can patch up his teammates health (Very Important).
The Engineer, who can patch up his teammates armor and deploy charges.
And finally, The Sniper, Self-explanatory.

For those people who say the game is Pay2Win, you can still do pretty well with the default M16 (it's not that bad). Yes, the cash shop has pretty expensive items, but you don't need the paid weapons" to do good.

So
date: should I recommend it to FPS fans?\nWell...Definitely yes
recommended: the co-op experience will give you a blast
hoursPlayed: especially when playing with friends. The multiplayer is your generic as your multiplayer experience can get (In other words
voteText: nothing new here).\nHowever
helpfulPercent: I wouldn't spend money in the game
votesHelpful: like I said before
votesTotal: you can do pretty decent even with the stock weapons.\n\nI hope to see Crytek making more interesting games in the future."

reviewText:
Warface is a free to play first person shooter by Crytek.  There are too many good things to say about this game that I cannot talk about it all in this review, but wow this game is amazing.  Being a multiplayer and co-op game only, it has no campaign, but that doesn't matter.  There are several multiplayer modes available, and not a single map that I don't like.  Tons of unlockable weapons, attachments, and equipment as well as an efficient ranking and clan system, providing hours of fun.  If you're not a PVP type of player, this game has enough co-op action to fulfill all your needs.  All co-op missions are fun, engaging, and challenging.  Best of all, the class system in the game forces you to work as a team, providing a perfect mix of tactical play styles as well as arcade-like play styles.  The game has near-perfect balance, and the devs are always in touch with the community.  Absolute best free to play out there.  100/100

P.S.

Contrary to popular belief, the lack of hit detection" is not a bug or a flaw in the game at all.  There is bullet travel and bullet drop in the game
date: so bullets don't always register immediately when shooting at longer ranges.  Quit whining!"

reviewText:
*Updated*
Though I would update my review with all of the changes that have occured thus far

Like any other FPS on the market, the community that surrounds the game will either make or break the game. Honestly I have a very mixed opinion on the community as a whole. On one hand I've been blessed with the good fortune of playing with some of the most helpful, friendly and skilled random players on here. On the other hand, I've also had the bad luck of playing with some of the most tribal, unfriendly, condescending, mean-spirited elistist on here. There's the noticable segregation between high ranking and low ranking players. Most high ranking players just flat out refuse to play with anyone lower ranking than themselves so they just kick them for no real reason most times. It's pretty much a random roll of the dice of whom you'll be playing with. Sometimes I wish there was an in-game avoid player button. It's truly a game you want to love but it just won't let you because of certain game designs and technical problems.

For starters anyone who has played this for at least a couple of rounds will notice that enemies appear out of thin air at certain points on the map either in front of you or behind you if you're moving too fast through a map. There's the Mech end stage boss and the helicopter end stage boss which for some reason have magical weapons that don't overheat or need reloading EVER. Spec Ops soldiers feel cheap no matter the difficulty setting and the equipment that is supposed to counter act its vision impairing laser don't work either. Repair cost are tricky and yet ridiculous at the same time. Even if you didn't use a weapon you had equipped during a match, you still are forced to repair it after a match is done. NO EXCEPTIONS. Initiation missions are rendered useless after you finished it the first time to unlock the other difficulties: Regular, Skilled and Hardcore. Why you ask? Because initiation mission pay is crap and more times than not, doesn't cover the repairs after you've completed the mission whether or not you were damaged playing through. If anything initiation missions should just cover all repair cost after you've finished it after the first playthrough.

Every now and then you'll get some knuckleheads who will come down with Rambo/Call of Duty Syndrome" and think they're invincible and run into a hail of bullets ahead of the rest of the team and get killed early on or immediately. Then there's the problem with people not playing their role properly. You've got medics who think and play like they are riflemen. Your team is bleeding to death and soaking up bullets and this hard charger is leading the group like he has no med pack at all. Then you've got riflemen who think and play like snipers (Not saying you can't shoot enemies at far distances but let the sniper do his job). And in turn snipers who think they are riflemen (You have a x5 scope why are fighting at close range charging groups of enemies?). And then there is the problem with people playing the engineer. These people don't even attempt to heal the team's armor barely ever.

But by far the biggest pet peeve I have with this game is the sometimes constant badgering done by dead teammates to try and rush the living teammates to the next checkpoint because they can't wait to respawn. These are the knuckleheads that are too impatient to let their teammates safely cross checkpoints without being swarmed by enemies shouting GO!
recommended:
GO! or HURRY UP! or GEEZ WHAT'S TAKING SO LONG!? People who give into these rude demands usually find themselves knocked down by an unknown riot shield and beaten to death or get shot to death by a spec ops they didn't see. Moral of the story: Never take advice from a dead man....

There is a Pay 2 Win aspect to this game but not to such a horrible degree other games do it. Namely warlord gear or any other armor that let's you regenerate health within a certain amount of seconds. You don't have to spend actual money to get this gear. You can grind missions and buy it with in-game cash so it's not necessarily exclusive to people paying cash for items. But it does make co-op missions feel cheap sometimes. You start to realize some of your teammates aren't as skilled as you once though. They're just regenerating health like some sort of weird mutant super soldier soaking up a jillion bullets in their chest and skulls

If the issues I have addressed don't bother you to much
hoursPlayed: then feel free to play this game. You might like it more than you think because if you take each review as fact or truth and not just opinion then you'll miss out on many other games besides this one. I enjoy the co-op here because it's one of the few experiences that really forces you to work as a team because the moment you don't
voteText: you'll realize how fast your team will fall apart (especially on insane difficulty). It's a game with flaws I won't lie to you there but if nothing else
helpfulPercent: it's one of the more fun distractions that deserves at least a single playthrough."
