reviewText:
This game adds the element of teamwork as a key feature, I like that.

The games Graphics are absolutely amazing, the gameplay mechanics are the best I've seen in an FPS game so far, and the game itself is just brilliant.

I just have a complaint about the hackers that I find on servers knifing at their spawn and somehow killing other players from across the map, but I mean you can't get rid of them all so it can be justified.

My favorite part about this game is the fact that it teaches you teamwork, I like it when I run into the middle of a gunfight just to heal my teammate, give him ammo, give him some armor, or maybe even revive him.

Overall, it's an outstanding game.

10/10

reviewText:
If you come here looking for a good Free to Play First person shooter experience; you aren't going to find it here.

1. Maps.

The maps in this game are smaller than a grain of rice, everything's close quaters and there's just stuff thrown in your face everywhere no matter where you go. It's nearly impossible to tell where you're being shot from sometimes and honestly it seems as if Shotguns dominate this game rather than being balanced all types of weapons and classes.

Nearly all the maps are just mirrors of one half being flipped around to make another, little to no variation in the terrain at all and a lot of verticality (maybe a little too much). The spawn system is probably the worst I've ever seen, generally only spawning you in a select area usually out in the open and unprotected. Very easy to spawn trap players if done right  which can be very frustrating.

2. Movement.

The movement in this game feels really sluggish and clunky rather than fluid and dynamic. Players have the ability to slide and go prone which is usually two features you don't see in most F2P games like this.

The problem with these mechanics is that they're easily abused because there's little to no animation when dropping down to go prone or when sliding meaning you can be in a gunfight with someone and then near instantly have them dissapear onto the ground with little to absolutely no time to react; nearly a free kill 100% of the time if you will.

Oh and there's no walk function either, found it really interesting how this game has features you don't normally see but doesn't have a walk function.

4.  Play 2 Win versus Pay 2 Win.

It's possible to Play 2 Win with a lot of dedication, but this game is definitely Pay 2 Win otherwise.

The majority of the guns you can buy at the start of the game are timed and can only be bought permanent with real cash, however there are weapons that you can buy with the in-game currency that are permanent but takes an unreasonably long time achieve.

5. General.

The game itself feels sluggish and slow even though the maps are very small and close quaters, games take forever to get started for how long they last without ever really seeing any action. The game-play itself is rather campy in my opinion and badly done due to how the maps are designed. The game doesn't really reward skill, just who has the better weapon and who can abuse the movement mechanics enough.

This game isn't worth the time it asks for.

reviewText:
A really awesome game, with both great co-op (PvE) and PvP. There are a lot of modes for PvP, Storm (A bit like rush in battlefield). CTF well... name says all. TDM and last but not least FFA!
PvE contains several missions, and there are a few new ones every day.

There are a few difficulties to choose from when doing PvE; Initiation, Skilled, Regular, Hardcore and Tower Raid. The tower raid is pretty much survival, with a lot of floors with a large variety of enemies, the higher you get the better the rewards. And hardcore actually is kinda hardcore ;p.
The game requires a lot of teamwork for you to be able to win.
The PvE maps are mainly objective based apart from the tower raid.
Gameplay is fast paced.

There's an ingame shop in which you can buy guns/skins/armor etc. You can unlock stuff in the ingame shop by just playing missions. You can buy items with either real money or ingame cash (Which is really easy to get). Most guns are perm. IT's totally fair.

I would really recommend this game!

reviewText:
A really awesome game, with both great co-op (PvE) and PvP. There are a lot of modes for PvP, Storm (A bit like rush in battlefield). CTF well... name says all. TDM and last but not least FFA!
PvE contains several missions, and there are a few new ones every day.

There are a few difficulties to choose from when doing PvE; Initiation, Skilled, Regular, Hardcore and Tower Raid. The tower raid is pretty much survival, with a lot of floors with a large variety of enemies, the higher you get the better the rewards. And hardcore actually is kinda hardcore ;p.
The game requires a lot of teamwork for you to be able to win.
The PvE maps are mainly objective based apart from the tower raid.
Gameplay is fast paced.

There's an ingame shop in which you can buy guns/skins/armor etc. You can unlock stuff in the ingame shop by just playing missions. You can buy items with either real money or ingame cash (Which is really easy to get). Most guns are perm. IT's totally fair.

I would really recommend this game!

reviewText:
Crytek appears to have made somewhat of a train wreck with this game. As a multiplayer experience, the game functions similarly to Battlefield, having 4 different classes all resembling those in BF3, but horribly unoptimized for team play. The only class I found any use for was the Medic, based on the fact that he can revive teammates (which is crucial in Co-op, your dumb teammates drop like flies from rushing into conflict too fast), but with one major downside: his weapon of choice, SHOTGUNS.

The shotguns are so broken in this game, it's hard to describe without snapping my keyboard in half from rage. Basically, every shotgun in the game fires a horribly inaccurate 4 to 5-pellet spread that can only one-shot an enemy if at point blank range, making the medic's offensive capabilites practically nonexistant. You can't rush in, shoot the guy who just gunned down your teammate, and then revive him, you fire about 3 shots before you finally kill the bugger, and by that point your teammate is pretty much dead anyway. This game flopped so hard they removed it from the Xbox 360 store just yesterday, Feb. 1st, 2015, less than a year after its release, so what does THAT tell you about the game designer's opinion of this steaming pile of trash?

Overall, this game isn't fun, it's broken, and it's the second biggest failure Crytek has made in the past 3 months, the first of which being Sonic Boom: Rise of Lyric, but I'm not gonna get into that.

If you want any more information on how much of a disappointment this game is, go watch Matimi0's review of it on YouTube, he does a lot more explaining than I did because I only talked about Medic, because it's the only class I played and it's the only class I gave a crap about playing.

reviewText:
TL:DR - If you're a selfish ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ you'll like this game. If you're one who likes team-work and a decent, fair, balanced fight you won't. Servers mean connections can be terrible.


Wanting a new FPS multiplayer I checked this out. It's fast paced and there's variety amongst classes and some great ideas, like co op climbing up high walls like you see in military vids. You give your team mate a bunk up then he helps you up, it's a great touch as is the baseball type slide feature. It's also got some ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥ ideas like having to pay to fix your rifle and gear which takes half your money that you earn each round, which is also pitiful. More annoyingly, you can't search for a server close to you, it just gives you a slot so connections are widely variable which means lag is a massive issue. I've had my end give me a kill then his end catches up and say that no, I actually died. You can't play like that. Your shots just go through people because they have already ♥♥♥♥ing moved and the connection hasn't caught up.

Also one plays to the classes. Medics don't revive (although the defib in this game is the worst designed feature I've seen) and riflemen never resupply. Every round I've played people are in it for themselves, they don't give a flying ♥♥♥♥ about you or the team. There are hackers everywhere and no one cares. I will never understand that mentality. I'll probably put a few more hours into it, because I haven't found a good FPS yet that I can just play a quick round or two whenever I want but I know I'll get ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off with the community here very quickly. So I can't recommend this game even though the game itslef is good, it's the community that ♥♥♥♥ it up and my search for a decent FPS continues. Also, ♥♥♥♥ EA.

reviewText:
I think Warface is quickly becoming one of my favorite FPS games. To me, Warface is essentially Call of Duty but without all of the ridiculous stuff like quick scoping (at least I haven't noticed any of that), it feels like it's more balanced and every player has a fair opportunity right off the bat. However, no game is without negatives so let's break down the positives and negatives in a list.

The Good:
- Balanced play style
- Real time weapon attachment system that allows you to switch out things like scopes and grips mid battle without having to wait until the round is over to edit the classes.
- Decent graphics even at the lowest graphic quality
- Movement and aiming feels very smooth (if you've played a lot of indie FPS games you know what I'm talking about)
- Runs perfectly fine on a stock computer from Walmart that's a few years old (you don't need a super computer to run it)
- The starting gear isn't as powerful as the gear you can buy later on but it's still good enough to win with, it doesn't feel under powered
- In game points earned from each round that can be spent on new equipment
- Sliding feature is unique and there are spots on some maps specifically for this, such as a small hole in a fence that you can slide under (some other FPS games have this but most don't)

The Bad:
- Some equipment can only be purchased for a limited time before it expires and you have to purchase it again (this is extremely annoying if you don't have a bunch of time to play the game every day as your equipment will be expired whenever you come back to it)
- Killcam shows who killed you and their position but it doesn't show the kill from their perspective
- Getting killed by a grenade doesn't show the enemy that threw it
- Some of the maps have a poor layout for a shooting game and force you to go to specific places or through choke holds which make it easy for the enemy team to spawn camp you and stops you from discovering your own play style
- Characters feel like they have no weight as you can walk up to a teammate and push them around and off ledges (this is really annoying when you're laying prone and a teammate walks by and pushes you out of position)

Could Be Added:
- Killstreak rewards like airdrops or missiles (similar to Call of Duty)
- Killcam through the perspective of the player that killed you (killcams like this are great for learning new positions and techniques)

Bugs/glitches:
- There is only one glitch that I've found and it allows you to see through a piece of cloth that you normally wouldn't be able to see through on the Airport map, however the amount of area that's revealed when doing this isn't really beneficial to the player enough to give them an advantage or warrant fixing immediately, just something for the developers to watch out for and possibly fix in an update.

Conclusion:
Over-all I think this game is great! It's very well balanced so you can get right in without dying every two seconds and it feels really smooth. The constant reminders of micro transactions are a bit annoying but I understand that developing a game like this isn't easy or free so I don't hold it against them too much. They have to make money some how to support future development and marketing and I think more people should take that into account before judging a game for micro transactions. Without a way for developers to make money we would have a lot less free games for you to add to your collection.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
A pretty good game, but a bit unrefined.

You buy different guns and items with ingame currency which you get from playing. You can buy guns and items for real life money, but they are reskins of the stuff you buy with the ingame currency. So it is NOT pay to win"

Everything is not available from the start. You choose either a gun attachment
recommended:
or a price of equipment to unlock. Then you unlock the chosen item by playing. You can only progress in one of the items each match. But you can change between the three without any loss in progress.

There's two main game modes. "Co-op" and "vs".
In "Co-op" you and a team of up to 5 play towards an objective. There's always 6 different missions
hoursPlayed:
and there changed every day. The missions have a slightly strange difficulty curve. Some missions I got through without dying one single time. Other missions the whole team failed before we could even reach the first checkpoint.

"VS" is your standard type of gamemode where there's two different teams. Theres the standard "team deathmatch" "Free for all" "Plant the bomb" Then there is "Storm" where you capture three points on the map in succession. "Capture"- A variation of capture the flag. And lastly "Destruction" where you deliver three air strikes on the enemy position. One team must hold the position on the map located in the center of the map.
I think the maps is a bit on the small side. Theres really no room to be playing sniper.

Overall I would give this game a 7/10. It is still in beta
voteText: and I think it could be a great game."

reviewText:
I think Warface is quickly becoming one of my favorite FPS games. To me, Warface is essentially Call of Duty but without all of the ridiculous stuff like quick scoping (at least I haven't noticed any of that), it feels like it's more balanced and every player has a fair opportunity right off the bat. However, no game is without negatives so let's break down the positives and negatives in a list.

The Good:
- Balanced play style
- Real time weapon attachment system that allows you to switch out things like scopes and grips mid battle without having to wait until the round is over to edit the classes.
- Decent graphics even at the lowest graphic quality
- Movement and aiming feels very smooth (if you've played a lot of indie FPS games you know what I'm talking about)
- Runs perfectly fine on a stock computer from Walmart that's a few years old (you don't need a super computer to run it)
- The starting gear isn't as powerful as the gear you can buy later on but it's still good enough to win with, it doesn't feel under powered
- In game points earned from each round that can be spent on new equipment
- Sliding feature is unique and there are spots on some maps specifically for this, such as a small hole in a fence that you can slide under (some other FPS games have this but most don't)

The Bad:
- Some equipment can only be purchased for a limited time before it expires and you have to purchase it again (this is extremely annoying if you don't have a bunch of time to play the game every day as your equipment will be expired whenever you come back to it)
- Killcam shows who killed you and their position but it doesn't show the kill from their perspective
- Getting killed by a grenade doesn't show the enemy that threw it
- Some of the maps have a poor layout for a shooting game and force you to go to specific places or through choke holds which make it easy for the enemy team to spawn camp you and stops you from discovering your own play style
- Characters feel like they have no weight as you can walk up to a teammate and push them around and off ledges (this is really annoying when you're laying prone and a teammate walks by and pushes you out of position)

Could Be Added:
- Killstreak rewards like airdrops or missiles (similar to Call of Duty)
- Killcam through the perspective of the player that killed you (killcams like this are great for learning new positions and techniques)

Bugs/glitches:
- There is only one glitch that I've found and it allows you to see through a piece of cloth that you normally wouldn't be able to see through on the Airport map, however the amount of area that's revealed when doing this isn't really beneficial to the player enough to give them an advantage or warrant fixing immediately, just something for the developers to watch out for and possibly fix in an update.

Conclusion:
Over-all I think this game is great! It's very well balanced so you can get right in without dying every two seconds and it feels really smooth. The constant reminders of micro transactions are a bit annoying but I understand that developing a game like this isn't easy or free so I don't hold it against them too much. They have to make money some how to support future development and marketing and I think more people should take that into account before judging a game for micro transactions. Without a way for developers to make money we would have a lot less free games for you to add to your collection.

reviewText:
I tend to avoid F2P games like the plague, but seeing how it has co-op, my friends and I decided to give it a shot.

It's terrible.  Absolute garbage.  The difficulty curve is as flat as Kansas.  If you have three people playing, you can just blow thorugh these co-op missions (which seeems to be only 6 of) in less than 2 hours.  You can't even access all the co-op without some stupid token crap.  There's no leaning, no cover system, it's just a complete step back in the genre and fully deserves its low metacritic score.

Avoid it.  It's not even worth the time to download.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
TL;DR  don't get it.

I got this game out of curiosity for the general distaste amongst the players for this game.

Gotta tell ya. They were right.

Warface, made by some Crytek dupes, uses the Crytek engine. Whatever that means. It has vaulting! Ooh! Helping others scale up walls! Aah! And it  really fricking sucks!  Waah. . .?

So, Warface is yet another modern/slightly futuristic FPS. It fights right in with Call of Duty and Battlefield. Has the same four classes: Rifleman (an assault character with an assault rifle that assaulting gives ammo assault boxes), Medic (a mister doctor man), Engineer (some guy with an SMG. There are also absolutely no vehicles to repair. He's sorta useless.), and Sniper (recon guy that hangs back near the spawn to pick off scrubs with 420 scope shots). They differ not a single bit. I've also heard none of these guns in real life. Not even a friggin Glock or 1911. It sorta stinks. Yet another bland shooter.

The snowy shots they show do not exist in game for as far as I can tell. Mainly urban, jungle, and sandy type maps that I've played. They're pretty bland, and seem to have no real creative-ness. There's a dock level. And a jungle level. And a city level. And a motel level. And another level. Pretty poor.

This game, like any other free to play, has microtransactions. Want some cool crud? Get KREDITS! Want a neat yellow covered thingamajigger? Get CROWNS (which are useless). Want a permanent weapon? Get KREDITS!

Yes, the main, gaping flaw of this game is that you cannot get permanent crud.  You gotta use Kredits or keep extending the lease to keep your guns after a day.

Also, let's get to the OP slide tackle. Shift (which is only a toggle, not a hold (can't change it as well)) and then pressing F will initiate a slide that let's you look super baller and super OP. They only way to screw up the slide tackle is if you miss. Which is never. If you get slide tackled, then RIP. You can nearly never return a slide tackle.

Also fire hurts you. That's weird.

In sum,

Pros +kinda free. . .?
+pretty ok gunplay
+community doesn't really care
+fire hurts you. Yay realism?

Cons -microtransactions around every corner
-takes AGES of grinding to unlock crud
-you have to keep EXTENDING YOUR LEASE ON WEAPONS AND GEAR
-VIP bonuses last a mere hour
-slide tackles that are OP
-stupid AI in co-op
-non existant community
-another mediocre and bland modern FPS. Can't they go back to Korea or Vietnam or something? That'd be nice.
-freemium

reviewText:
Firstly, this game is perfectly acceptable in some ways.  I like PvE shootery stuff.  I like the fantasy feels with the modern military theme.  Works fine.

Making people unable to play medics or engineers out of the gate is dumb.  You know what?  Classes should be playable.  No one is allowed to get rezzed because no one has medic unlocked is just a bad plan.

The mouse's aim speed literally changes at random at all times.  I cannot hit anything because it decides it's going to go way faster or way slower basically at the drop of a hat.

This game has hard-locked, memory-dump-and-bluescreened my Win 8.1 machine twice in only an hour's playtime.

I uninstalled this already.  The technical problems are too great (seriously, randomly changing mouse sensitivity?), and with Crytek employees not going to work and not getting paid, I have no confidence that this will get out of beta.

reviewText: DId not enjoy this one bit, roughly 6 hour of gameplay. The aiming system did not feel very fluid, issues with switching targets was noticable even after adjusting the controls. Had very little in the sense of AI development, they just rush at you almost blindly unless spawned in certain points. Worst was the spawning, which was the only real part of the difficulty that I could notice playing. You can be looking at a truck, 10 feet from you and a spawn timer activates and boom you are dead. The leveling system was poor and the purchases were just bad. Timers were on two of the guns that I got and you only get them for a day.\n\nI would write more, but really not worth it for this game. I now see why Crytek is going under as a company....

reviewText:
I've played only 2 hours, but in those 2 hours i've found some positive stuff and some negative. i will begin with the negative.

The Serverhosting. It's terrible. I have 150mb/s download and i keep lagging out in game.
The loading times are horrible. They don't need te loading bar because it freezes at the first part and then after 2 minutes it just flies to full.
Pay 2 Win. I did expect this, it's a free game so they need to make some money right?

now the positive things.
I love the combat, it's fast pased, easy to understand and balanced. You don't see one person rushing around with the an unbalanced gun killing everything in it's path. This game is based on Skill (and a good internet connection)
The unlocking system. Choosing what you're gonna unlock is pretty fun, never seen something like it before so kudos for being original.
Attachments are done amazing. I like how you can switch out while you're in game, you really see that you're playing on CryEngine.

Hopefully this is helpfull. I would not reccomend the game yet, unless there's a server fix because it's really annoying to lagg around even thought you pay good money for internet.

reviewText:
If you want to help this game grow then by all means play but dont expect anything fresh.

the game graphically looks ok for the most part but its treading to the orange and blue fps colour scheme.

There is no contex to suppliment your actions other than your buddies are good and the people shooting at you are bad. even on the daily new content" missions: protect this tank
hoursPlayed: there are no stakes within the story and the only thing that is at risk is that you will have to do the same mission again.\n\nThe ai
voteText: in my opinion is too twitchy and too pin point
helpfulPercent: they (in my experience) do not variate on what they do. this becomes problematic when one of them are mounted on the turret or are armed with a rocket launcher. to furthur explain: i find myself dying to a rocket that popped as soon as i turned the corner. the way they alleviate the the difficulty is that they give you a certain amount of time where the ai you are shooting wont do anything(basically just stares at you
votesHelpful: often standing and not behind any corner) to give you a time to react.\n\nunfortunately if you are playing in the lower levels your success will depend on your team (maximum of 5 people) and since medic engineer are locked you will either just to turtle your way to the end alone or find and stick with reliable teammates. even with a great team
votesTotal: every one could get wiped out with a couple of rockets (less chances withought a reliable medic).\n\nalso
votesFunny: the game broke my soumd system (repeating explosions) 4 times and i had to quit the game and reboot my computer to fix it.\n\nI really expected more from crytek but instead we got a stale co-op shooter."

reviewText:
This game looked good until the moment I downloaded it.

The first week I had it installed there was no 'Login' button on the launcher so I couldn't even start it up. After I reinstalled it I could finally log in, although now I wish I had never tried.

It feels like they took the worst parts from Counter Strike, Battlefield, and Call of Duty and shoved them into a Pay-To-Win piece of crap. They want you to work as a team but give you no real reason to try, it's just a big run-and-gun fest where the rich players dominate the poor players with OP guns.

I could go on for hours but this game really isn't worth my or your time.

This game doesn't deserve a MetaCritic score above 30.

reviewText:
This game has potentional it could really do good, but there are alot of flaws. If you have a laptop this game will overhear you GPU and CPU your laptop might crash. This never happened to me but if you look on the Warface disscussions page it seems to be happening to alot of people. This is a Pay To Win game, it's not like call of duty where people can go on overpowered kill streaks for the whole game, its just helmats preventing head shots is kind Pay to win.

In the game Engineeners can get alot of kills the bombs are hard to see and usually damages your health and armour when you shout at them. BTW they never de-spawn until you destroy it. Medic the Shotguns are overpowered with on shot 1 kill, but when it comes to shoting long range it's as all shotguns are rubbish

Now we come to the worst part of the game the FREE FOR ALL. This is the most annoying gamemode just filled with campers  and gets annoying when every where you go you get sniped all the time even when you spawn there are usually land miners or people waiting for you. They said the optimized the game so people would find it hard to camp but I have play BF4 and most the COD games and by far (a lot) this has the most campers i have ever seen. People will complain camping is not against the rules. Your right it's not it just makes the game less fun for everyone else.

The Team Death Match is very good and it's requires a bit of team work. The Co-OP is amazing on of the best co-ops on Free to Play games you can. This game could do very well if they just fix a couple bugs and remove the Pay to Win and improve the store which is horrible everything is overprice and it requires about 20 hours of gameplay just for a pistol which was not worth.

I recommend this game to people who have never played that many FPS games before.
Thanks for Reading :)
voteText: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Beware this game's monetization scheme. You pay real money for *TEMPORARY* unlocks. Those $20 you spent creating the perfect look? Gone within a couple weeks. That weapon you liked so much? Gone after 7 days.

I've seen this scheme in half-baked korean online shooters before, and I was hoping crytek would be above this, but apparently, it's too difficult to think of a scheme that is not so insulting.

If you do decide to play it, make sure you give it enough time for your spectacle starting items to wear out. Play it barebones before you give them any money, or you'll be stuck paying to prevent a sub-par experience.

----
Wow, there's only 6 missions. I've completed 3 of them and let me say, the boss fights are a super cheap way to force you to buy resurrection items.

reviewText:
It came as a surprise for me to see this game on Steam in BETA. I remember playing it a couple of  years ago in Russia on a distribution platform called Games Mail.ru.

The game was fun and at that point it seemed good if it was not a freemium game where to really play you need to pay more than you would pay for CoD or CS:GO, which are much better games. Now playing it again after these years on Steam and seeing that it has a BETA badge I am surprised.It has not changed a lot and I feel there is no effort put to improve it. Besides what annoys me that I get message that I am running out of memory when playing it. I played the version on Mail.ru and it never did that. Maybe it has something to do with my newer PC, but other games work fine such as Assassin's Creed 4 and Witcher 2, or other FPS games such as CS:GO.

This game is very dissapointing. It feels that it is just another way to milk money from consumers for nothing.

reviewText:
Warface is a pretty good. Really nice PVP and PVE modes, great graphics and gameplay!
It's a proper free-to-play, since you can have lots of fun without spending a cent in it - more games should be like this.

But, there is a huge problem: hackers.
When you first start playing, it's all good because you are matched with players that have similar levels, but once you reach about level 9/10, you automatically join a higher level" of matchmaking and you're matched with players of very high levels. If you got used to nice balanced and fair games
date: I'm sorry to disappoint you by telling you what happens now... yeap
recommended: you guessed it: ♥♥♥♥ing hackers EVERYWHERE. My first game in this new matchmaking system and I caught two hackers in the same game
hoursPlayed: aimbotting and wallhacking... this really ruined the experience for me.\n\nI still recommend this game for what it is as a FPS
voteText: and I still play it for the co-op experience

reviewText:
Fantastic game! Having some much fun, Will do a more detailed review once i've put a few more hours into the game.

Edit:
So basically the game is split into 2 parts: versus and co-op. The Versus is pretty lack-luster in my experience, the objectives are all very simple and nothing in the versus forces players to take advantage of the team-based classes of the game. The maps are all so small and tight that it just turns into a grenade-spamming, corner-camping brawl. There's no regenerating health or armor in this game, so you tend to be worthless after a kill as your health and armor will stay low. Now, it can be repaired by team-mates of course, but it won't, because there are only 2 classes that can repair you and the odds of both of them getting to you before someone sullies your face with buckshot is quite low. In fact, the game is so campy that medics are simply not played right now. That's right, the versus takes such low advantage of the class system that they basically made the most important class obselete. Frankly, the versus isn't worth your time.

However this game shines in co-op. The co-op missions force the use of all 4 classes, and after you play for a while, you begin to appreciate how it's designed. All 4 classes in the game are support classes and going through any mission without one of each class is incredibly difficult. The engineer gives armor which protects you from burst damage like grenades, missiles, and sniper rounds; whereas the medics protect people from the sustained damage of going through extended battles. The soldier replenishes team ammo and sniper is the most prolific at taking down high priority targets that the other classes don't have the range to shoot. When playing the coop, anytime a single class dies the mission becomes incredibly difficult; forcing your squad to play smart and get to know each other.

The game forces you to depend on your teammates which is a blessing to the coop and the bane of the versus

Leveling up is kind of a grind, like in most f2p's, but the way you unlock things is kind of interesting. There are 3 types of vendors" that you can switch between at any time and whichever one you have selected you will get progress toward unlocking that item. It randomly selects what your reward will be by picking from a pool of variably rare items. It's not too bad
date: since unlocking things isn't too slow and once you unlock something it is always unlocked. The attachments for guns are quite numerous and can be swapped out in-game which is very cool. The game gives you 2 ways to buy things
recommended: you can rent things temporarily or buy it permanently. The rent option is basically there to try something out before you buy it. If you buy something
hoursPlayed: you will have to pay to upkeep it but the cost is not overly grievous. To be honest
voteText: I'm not sure what the point of it is
helpfulPercent: it seems like an unnecessary tax. You only have to upkeep the equipment you use so if you buy something and don't use it right away
votesHelpful: it won't degrade. Basically
votesTotal: the f2p system isn't as flawed as the early reviews make it out to be.\n\nThe games biggest problem is simply a lack of content. The versus modes are limited and all lacking in depth
votesFunny: the maps are also limited in number in very lacking in depth. The co-op missions are very deep however
commentsCount: but also lacking in quantity. There are 3 new missions every day
column16: but that gives you a very harshly limited time to complete the hardcore missions and also they just recycle the same 6 or 7 maps each day. The paths are always the same and the spawns vary slightly so there's just a flat out lack of content. Also
column17: the player base (at least in NA) is small atm
column18: and can make finding groups difficult when your not playing during prime time. Just convince your friends to download it and try
column19: it's free and a ton of fun with some friends."

reviewText:
Rank:	7/10
Recommendation(s):	Play some other free FPS games before, have a reasonable setup.
Major Theme:	One of the better spins on Asian free 2 play FPS games.
Bought at Price:	$0 - F2P

I think I've played, if not seen every free 2 play FPS title out there. Some I've come to like more than others. Warface is in that category for sure.

So what makes this title stand out of the crowd you ask? For starters, it's built off the trusted CryEngine. Other major F2P titles are on outdated engines. Take for instance Combat Arms and Crossfire. The benefit of having a better engine is that it looks better, feels more responsive, and is less prone to abuse. Common glitching" isn't to be found in this title due to having a engine that works so much better.

Gameplay because of the engine is also better. Player vs. Player maps feel more rich and detailed to a higher degree
date: and COOP play feels better and more dynamic. The interesting thing about COOP is that you can earn "Crown" points by completing the challenges given to you (beat the level in a certain time
recommended: etc.). These points can be used to buy limited time upgrades. That being said
hoursPlayed: AI needs work still in COOP.\n\nDownside is certainly GFace account system. This game does not directly interface with Steam
voteText: and thus requires you to remember details for a useless account.\n\nThe silly weapon rental system found in other games is also here
helpfulPercent: along with in-game currency. There's this odd weapons/item progression system I still don't get. You can select one of 3 different areas to focus your XP gains in
votesHelpful: and unlock items/weapons from that area.\n\nIf you want to spend a few hours here and there on a casual FPS
votesTotal: this is the place to go. Warface is certainly more worthwhile than Combat Arms and Crossfire – the two major competitors to this title."

reviewText:
Is this game fun with friends? Yes.

Playing mostly PVE playlists the game can be extremely fun when with a group of players that know their role and work well in a group setting. Missions and tower raids are reminiscent of mmo raids somewhat, except with a FPS vibe.

The A.I. can be lackluster at times, but the mechanics of the game are sound. A band-aid dispenser, a bullet hose, a welder, and a snipper all have useful roles. Customization is is nice as well, with all gear, guns, and outfits being available with the in-game currency. While shooting can be shoddy due to lag, guns are satisfying. From personal playtime most guns are fun and viable to use. In a PVE setting the best of the best of the killing machines is never required. The UI is simple and easy to navigate.

The developers have been very active with the game such as daily map rotations, promos for free gear. and updates/hotfixes. Guns and gear also have a cycle as well. In fact, many recent changes have been for the better, with the shop changing to in game currency reducing the pay-to-win structure that turned off many players in the past.

Sadly though the community and its mentality of its players makes this game a total turn-off. Playing with randoms is damn-near impossible; players vote-kick without reason, people loving to micromanage and ♥♥♥♥♥ about everything other players do, and while hacking is seen once and while due to no real anticheat system, players accuse others non-stop of being a hacker/cheater more than the actual act itself. The paranoia and ego of players in this game is sickening. I can see competition in PVP happening, but when everyone is going towards a common goal in PVE, who really cares if someone can get more kills than you? ITS PVE.

I love the mechaincs of the game and focused effort to make teamwork prosper, but the community makes it fall flat. If you want to deal with squeakers calling haxxxx and people thinking its time for xxXX420nosc0peblazeitXXxx this is the game for you. Otherwise, into the trash it goes.

reviewText:
This game has A LOT of problems with stupid DLC to weird hitmarkers. But this is just your basic shooter.
So here is just some stupid pros and cons.

I know I haven't played this on the PC a lot, I have played this on my Xbox 360 A LOT before.

CONS:

-I ABSOLUTLY HATE how you haft to pay for EVERYTHING if you want to get some guns fast.
You can play this game OKAY for completely free, but just getting new guns (that are actually good) can take DAYS

-You can't hold down shift to sprint (I have looked at the settings)

-There is the stupidest hitmarkers

-STUPID SPAWNING! There is only 1 spawn for EVERY SINGLE MAP IN EVERY SINGLE GAME IN EVERY SINGLE TEAM! Which means you can get completely R4KT'D BY FREAKING STUPID BUTT HOLES ALL THE TIME!

-The maps are WAY too small, but it gains itself with A LOT of places to hide.

-Damage is really low (kinda expected from a CoD copy off or something)

-Very few graphics quality settings (but I don't really have a problem with it)

Pros:

-Gunplay is decent. It has sprinting, ADS, crouching, proning, jumping, basically same as CoD

-The attachment system is AWESOME, changing attachments while in game is pretty sweet.

-CO-OP is decent and clever, you really haft to team up with your classes and such to actually win, and there is sometimes MECHS THAT KICk BUTT!

-There are a quite a few maps

-There are a quite a few guns

-It is pretty basic and you can learn quickly



Overall, if you like CoD or other FPS', but don't have the money, this is a great substitute and keeps you playing if you don't pay anything.

BUUUUT if you do have the money but your like, OH BUT HERE IS A FREE FPS HERE WOOPIE!" then this game completely SUCKS BALLS compared to battlefield or CoD."

reviewText:
For every flaw in Warface, there's a good thing about it. I used my own personal experience and some of the other reviews to pile a list together of the good and bad things of this game. Here they are:

Flaws:                                                          Good things:
Limited weapons ,                                       Co-op mode with bosses and waves of enemies,
Odd rage-doll physics,                                 Intense Versus matches,
Pay to win,                                                   Certain weapons you will keep permanently that will get the job done,
For Windows 8 people: Home Button         Free to Play game with great graphics,
won't send you to the Start Menu if
your on fullscreen.

I'd say if you dislike pointshops where not every single thing you can purchase is permanent and will not cost you any real
money, then this game is not for you. If your a gamer who likes a intense FPS game like COD and Battlefield, this game is perfect for you. For me, I'd say that I had an overall fun time playing this game. I can say without a doubt that this is a step up for Free to Play games.

reviewText:
Good game. especially if you like playing with other players in co-op mode.
It has a lot of different missions changing each day.
There is also Pvp and with their own modes and maps.
The unlock system in the game is also quite different,
you can choose from 3 vendors to unlock items.
The first vendor is Weapon to unlock new weapons, the second is Equipment to unlock new attachments for your weapon, and the last one is outfit for new armour.

reviewText: If you are looking for a strictly multiplayer experience this one is a preditable but fairly solid game.  The part that shines through for me is the Co-Op mode.  You have choices of initiate, regular, skilled, and hard.  The levels and requirements swap out each day to give you a different experience.  The biggest downfall of this game is that it is extremely held back by the micro transactions.  You can play all the modes and levels but guns and armor is very limited until you have many hours or have dropped some cash into it.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
For every flaw in Warface, there's a good thing about it. I used my own personal experience and some of the other reviews to pile a list together of the good and bad things of this game. Here they are:

Flaws:                                                          Good things:
Limited weapons ,                                       Co-op mode with bosses and waves of enemies,
Odd rage-doll physics,                                 Intense Versus matches,
Pay to win,                                                   Certain weapons you will keep permanently that will get the job done,
For Windows 8 people: Home Button         Free to Play game with great graphics,
won't send you to the Start Menu if
your on fullscreen.

I'd say if you dislike pointshops where not every single thing you can purchase is permanent and will not cost you any real
money, then this game is not for you. If your a gamer who likes a intense FPS game like COD and Battlefield, this game is perfect for you. For me, I'd say that I had an overall fun time playing this game. I can say without a doubt that this is a step up for Free to Play games.

reviewText:
This game has A LOT of problems with stupid DLC to weird hitmarkers. But this is just your basic shooter.
So here is just some stupid pros and cons.

I know I haven't played this on the PC a lot, I have played this on my Xbox 360 A LOT before.

CONS:

-I ABSOLUTLY HATE how you haft to pay for EVERYTHING if you want to get some guns fast.
You can play this game OKAY for completely free, but just getting new guns (that are actually good) can take DAYS

-You can't hold down shift to sprint (I have looked at the settings)

-There is the stupidest hitmarkers

-STUPID SPAWNING! There is only 1 spawn for EVERY SINGLE MAP IN EVERY SINGLE GAME IN EVERY SINGLE TEAM! Which means you can get completely R4KT'D BY FREAKING STUPID BUTT HOLES ALL THE TIME!

-The maps are WAY too small, but it gains itself with A LOT of places to hide.

-Damage is really low (kinda expected from a CoD copy off or something)

-Very few graphics quality settings (but I don't really have a problem with it)

Pros:

-Gunplay is decent. It has sprinting, ADS, crouching, proning, jumping, basically same as CoD

-The attachment system is AWESOME, changing attachments while in game is pretty sweet.

-CO-OP is decent and clever, you really haft to team up with your classes and such to actually win, and there is sometimes MECHS THAT KICk BUTT!

-There are a quite a few maps

-There are a quite a few guns

-It is pretty basic and you can learn quickly



Overall, if you like CoD or other FPS', but don't have the money, this is a great substitute and keeps you playing if you don't pay anything.

BUUUUT if you do have the money but your like, OH BUT HERE IS A FREE FPS HERE WOOPIE!" then this game completely SUCKS BALLS compared to battlefield or CoD."

reviewText:
Warface.

It is.. Well..  Pretty good game, for free2play game.
Still, it has many errors, bugs and problems.
Here is some most annoying problems: game crashes JUST before you have your experience points and money and all that kind of stuff.. at some maps, enemies just run to wall when you are right behind them, and when you are trying to stab them, they do not die.. When you shut down the launcher, steam does still think that the game is on and you got no other way to play something than restart you computer (trust me).

Warface is CoD remake with badder EVERYTHING. (Craphics, gameplay, details, story, weapons etc)
It has several gamemodes like Versus (PVP), CO-OP (PVE) and SURVIVAL (PVE).
-In CO-OP you will be ALWAYS trying to kill enemies in moving vehicle (that is harder than you think),  trying to save same kind of vehicle, destroying motherf*cking godlike robotmachine and after all, trying to get strangers to do what you say.
-In versus you can choose between tdm, dm, capturing 3 controlpoints, capturing case and cs go competive.
-In survival you just survival. Its boring, you can play one match in day (you gotta one accest coin in 3.00pm), but still it is the best gamemode in game.

So, if you dont got any money to spend games, go ahead. Play.
Just remember, that you still gotta pay to win.
Seriosly, I dont recommend this. BTW, sorry for my bad english, it isnt my native language..

reviewText: I am recommending this game for a number of reasons. There are a lot of negative reviews that need justifying. This game is in NO WAY P2W. There are micro transactions sure. But they aren't game breaking in any way. On top of that, there is a renting system. This renting system is pointless in my opinion, but good if you wanted to try a weapon out for a day or more. You can unlock PERMANENT weapons with leveling up and if you pick the weapon option. This is one of the funnest FPS games I've played since MW2. Sliding doesn't make people invincible although they do need to fix the hitboxes to make it more reliable when shooting at them. All in all, this game deserves a better rating then what it gets from people who play for 30 mins and quit because they don't get into the game enough to see how wrong they are.

reviewText:
It's Alright. I like how the game is not completly pay to win, but the mechanics could be better.
For example:
Tactic to clear rooms and check corners:
Slides and Dropshots.
Yes, while this game is full of slides and dropshots, I seemed to not encounter too many. I play alot of tactical FPS games like ArmA and Insurgency, but sometimes I need a break from the slow paced gameplay. And that's where this game comes in. With a couple of hours, you can be dominating at this game getting 9 kill streaks like I do. The system of unlocking is solid as well.
Pros:
Graphics
The gameplay is good
Unlocking system
Simplicity(not too much of a learning curve if you play alot of CoD)
Teamwork" system
Some of the guns look pretty sick

Cons:
Hackers(not too many but when there are they are really annoying)
Sometimes you feel really slow when you walk around and shoot
The pay to win players OH MY ♥♥♥♥ING GOD THE PAY TO WIN PLAYERS they buy the best stuff and lay everyone to waste
Playerbase could be stronger
Not as good as Insurgency
Really not that realistic

reviewText:
This game has potential. Especially in regards to customisation content. Otherwise its just plain Generic.


Pros:
Some good game modes, including some Coop friendly PvE modes.
I like saying Warface.
I get to dress up a little.
I get to touch my teammates intimately on certain context sensitive areas.

Cons:
Currently I'm not happy with the gunplay and the movement - its awkward and stilted compared to most online shooters.
I found the Crysis 2 multiplayer a lot better than this, and with them both being CryEngine games dev'ed by Crytek, I think its a fairly relevant comparison (Crysis 2 MP was *amazing* imo).
Squad-play gets thrown out of the window as soon as a fight starts - Being a practicing medic is asking to get shot with your defib hanging out. They do get cool shotguns though, might as well go for a killing spree instead.

reviewText: I am recommending this game for a number of reasons. There are a lot of negative reviews that need justifying. This game is in NO WAY P2W. There are micro transactions sure. But they aren't game breaking in any way. On top of that, there is a renting system. This renting system is pointless in my opinion, but good if you wanted to try a weapon out for a day or more. You can unlock PERMANENT weapons with leveling up and if you pick the weapon option. This is one of the funnest FPS games I've played since MW2. Sliding doesn't make people invincible although they do need to fix the hitboxes to make it more reliable when shooting at them. All in all, this game deserves a better rating then what it gets from people who play for 30 mins and quit because they don't get into the game enough to see how wrong they are.

reviewText: OK...SO...I got this game when it was first released on steam. I played it for about an hour then stoped until about a couple weeks ago when i ran into it again. reviewText:
Pay to win game. They force you to pay to even have a chance to pay for repairs even for non-paytowin gear. The regular top gear for ingame money cost more than you earn in a game to repair.

Slidefest. You are appearantly frictionless in this game cuz you slide for 5-10 meters on any surface. While sliding you also have no accuracy penatly like you can actually aimdownsight without any problems during a slide. Very realistic.

The slidefest range and speed and the fact that the paytowin shotguns have a huge range with oneshot potential in ANY bodypart is killing the game.

Claymore mines that stay even when you die also make the game quite boring but thats just a slight bad part. Imo in games like this claymores or any rocketry weapons don't fit in at all to begin with.

----

The possitive thing is the tempo and the maps are mostly quite well made. In the early game where not so many paytowin people are you can actually play fair. I came in 1st place 90% of the time up til lvl 13 where you jump up to meet any higher level players which include all the paytowinners. After that I stuggled hard to reach top 5 any game.

I do think you should pay to play a good game but forcing players to pay the way they do it is purely boring and really killing the game.
I Play Path Of Exile which is also a FreeToPlay game but they have a non-paytowin system. They still make a fortune of money because they let all players enjoy the game and earn money by fan supporters and skin/effect sales.

reviewText: How should I put this... Warface is intresting. The gameplay is really fun, the levels are no pushover... and... it's still in beta. Usually I get quite lucky with early access games like this, but this time I did not. An hour or so into the game, while having a grand ole' time, the game sound cuts out, and in it's place comes an alien-like sound. It changes from sounding like an SSTV transmission, to pac-man, multiple times. I asked my friend if he was having the same issue and he said no.  I thought the sound might have been my speakers, as they are really old, but turning off the game revealed that is was in fact Warface. Aside from that bug, gameplay is great, and the mechanics need a bit of work but thats to be expected. Try it out for your self, play with a friend, whatever. It's worth a shot. Give Crytech's first F2P game a chance. Oh, and the graphics, It was easy to tell that the textures were designed so machines that aren't beasts could play it, which is welcome. I'm glad one game has successfully done that. *cough cough Planetside 2*

reviewText:
This is hard to rate not because of my hours played but because recommending it is different to just playing.

So I decided to go for the thumbs up. Why?


Pros.

Its free to play (why wouldnt you try it)
You get your basic FPS here, its fast, its full of action
Plenty of maps
Different game modes for variety
Fun for 30mins-1hour a session
Different weapons for different playstyle

Cons

Join a game with your friends there not on your team.
Join a game with your CLAN mates, theres no guarante there on your team
Messy multiplayer team up (never had 2 of my mates on my team in any games we played so far,I dont want to shoot my mates i want to play with them)
RENT A GUN FOR CERTAIN AMOUNT OF DAYS???? when I got a gun and enjoyed it and said its expired That was enough for me.
The game makes you feel like you Own nothing.
I got a 7 day VIP so i got bonus money xp etc and I still feel like I achived nothing.
Expired items spam every time i log in


So many cons compared to pros and thats why its hard to rate up or down, so i rated up because you have to try it your self and because its free you have nothing to lose, dont be tempted to buy things because you will regret it.

I played mostly assault class and I was quite good at the game so I'm not writing the review on saltyness.

reviewText:
OverviewGameplay: 8/10
Sounds: 6/10
Multiplayer: 5/10
Graphics: 6/10

Pros & Cons+ Large selection of gamemodes from Co-op missions to PvP to FFA
+ Slide & shoot feature
+ Weapon selection
+ Weapon feeling & punch
+ Co-op quality & map design
+ Above average animations
- Strange washed out color palette
- Odd looking character faces
- Poor PvP map design
- Badly animated player animations ; instant prone to dodge
- Abhorrent net code

ConclusionI've edited this review a few times now, and sadly the game has dropped from an 8 to now a 6. Warface looks and feels great, but the more you play it the more you begin to notice shoddy work by the development team ranging from small details such as not animated faces to the awful netcode.

6/10

reviewText: OK...SO...I got this game when it was first released on steam. I played it for about an hour then stoped until about a couple weeks ago when i ran into it again. The reason I stoped playing was, right off the bat I saw it USE TO BE a pay to win game. However now I cant stop playing it! The in game kredits you can buy go to mostly cosmetic things such as calling cards/character skins/respawn tokens(Respawn tokens are for co-op missions) Also as far as I can see they keep updating the game often, and have fun little events to win some cool ingame prizes. The games over all first impresions made me think of battlefield and call of duty. All around I give this f2p shooter a SOLID 8.5/10.

reviewText:
Warface is an FPS game that is very entertaining and if your playing with friends then it can be a good thing to just generally play or mess around on as it features both COOP or Versus(plus special ops) so it gives a variety of things to play on there if you and a friend wanted to play the game

It has customisation towards your character such as weapons,skins and armor which i personally think is a unique thing to this game as many people would call it a COD rip off but very few COD games allow as much customisation as this does as well as the fact that the recent installments to COD have been kind of a let down in terms of gameplay

I recommend this game to anyone who likes FPS games and likes playing them with friends as i believe it could make a great game to play with friends

reviewText: Believe the other negative reviews that have been voted most useful. reviewText:
As a 3-year veteran at rank 31 (which is actually really bad), I have over 500 hours on this.  When I first starting playing it there were very few game modes to chose from.  The coop screen had only three difficulties; easy, medium and hard.  The versus (I don't really remember what everything looked like) had maybe team death match, plant the bomb, and free-for-all.  Special Operations were included in coop originally, but several additions to SO were put in, which made it stand out as one separate mode.  The original SO had just tower raid, which was 18 floors of increasingly more difficult AI's attacking you with shotguns, knives and other explosives; and just MAYBE Cold Peak.

With the doubling of coop missions (now Easy, 2 normal, 2 hard, and one insane), tripling of versus (now free-for-all, team death match, plant the bomb, bag-and-tag, storm, capture, and domination), and tripling of Special Ops (now tower raid, Cold peak, and cyber horde), this game has been my most played game for over 2 years.

There was just a recent update called Operation Coliseum" which I haven't played yet (cuz I'm writing this review)
date: I don't know if it's Special Ops or not yet.\n\nCoop missions start with your team (consisting of between 3-5 players depending on which difficulty your on) entering the map in a chopper
recommended: rather than just spawning in the map randomly.  After leaving the chopper and walking a bit away
hoursPlayed: it will fly away far beyond the map's exterior and not show up again until the end of the section.  Once in the map
voteText: players much work as a team to complete the mission by killing all enemies (called "Blackwood)
helpfulPercent: including regular
votesHelpful: on-ground fighters
votesFunny: shields and machine gunners.  There is a mid-map boss called a heavy gunner which can only be killed by shooting him in his back with heavy fire.  One good way of killing him is by flanking him and waiting for him to have his back towards you.  Once he starts to reload his machine gun
commentsCount: the sniper and medic can reek all havoc on his back and kill him.  I have been in games where 3 or 4 veteran players automatically
column16: without thinking
column17: go into strategic battle alignment and kill him instantly.  It is POSSIBLE to kill him yourself (I speak from 2 experiences)
column18: but you need to be patient and resourceful for a long time.\n\nTowards the end of most games
column19: there is a boss called a "mech"
column20: which is very hard to kill.  You have to use bazooka-like guns to shoot him in his belly several times before he falls.  When he is down
column21:
you must shoot the top of his head until he dies.  Repeat several times.

Only 2 maps have an enemy chopper to destroy at the end.  To destroy them all you have to do is shoot it with bazookas like 10 times.

I know I'm going on and on about this game without really REVIEWING it.  So here's my opinion.

One of the pros to warface are the games modes.  There are 15 possible games to chose from (listed above)
column22: and dozens of maps to play them on.  My favorite modes are storm
column26: and easy.  I can complete easy by myself so I usually just find 2 or 3 noob players to carry them through it.  On the dark side I usually need 3 or 4 veteran players to carry ME through the insane maps lol.\n\nThis game needs two things: A single player campaign (or better yet a campaign where a team of 3 or 4 friends can play through several hours of Blackwood enemies and missions
column27: all in one big "story") and a decent voice chat.\n\nOne con to this entire game are the hackers.  In EVERY SINGLE MAP there is at least ONE hacker who has an outrageous KD who no one can kill.  Luckily Crytek has implemented "fair-fight" into Warface
column28: so every few days I get a worldwide notification that "so-and-so" got banned for life.\n\nThat's all from me
column29: I highly recommend this game for anyone who likes immersive coop missions and severely intense special ops.  Its free and only takes 2 hours to download.  HAVE FUN!!!\n\nAlmost forgot
column30: most of the original coop maps aren't available thanks to the new updates and maps that come out every few months."

reviewText:
This is my first view so bare with me.

Warface is a free to play FPS that is a mix of cod with Crysis minus the suit powers, along with a battlefield-ish class system.

Pros:
Free updates that are released every few weeks
Exp events that are released regularly
Doesn't force you to buy better weapons with real world money like combat arms
The developers actually listen to the community feedback and are willing to make changes accordingly
This game isn't owned by EA thankfully
You can customize your guns while in battle (this includes PVP) just like the first crysis game!
YOU CAN BUY MOSTLY ALL ITEMS WITH IN-GAME MONEY

Cons:
Servers (if there are any) are decent and still suffer lag and hitbox issues
Hackers and cheaters roam free since there's no anti-cheat enabled (thankfully there is a votekick option)
it's slow to level up without the VIP bonus
The game isn't entirely balanced

I wouldn't bother to listen to the other reviews about people complaining about microtransactions or pay2win since they obviously don't know how marketing works, the developers need to sell items that would be worth purchasing or otherwise they would no one would buy anything to support the devs, therefor making no profit. Warface is one of the best F2P FPS's I've played in a while, since the main reason being that buying Kredits (in-game currency that you have to pay for IRL) is totally optional and not mandatory, I've managed to get a lot of items without spending a cent.

Conclusion:this game is worth trying if you don't mind grinding a bit to get weapons and equipment,it's fun and interesting. In the end it's a better alternative then A LOT of the other F2P FPS's out there. You can get any gun you want permanently if you just work for it a bit.

reviewText:
This is hard to rate not because of my hours played but because recommending it is different to just playing.

So I decided to go for the thumbs up. Why?


Pros.

Its free to play (why wouldnt you try it)
You get your basic FPS here, its fast, its full of action
Plenty of maps
Different game modes for variety
Fun for 30mins-1hour a session
Different weapons for different playstyle

Cons

Join a game with your friends there not on your team.
Join a game with your CLAN mates, theres no guarante there on your team
Messy multiplayer team up (never had 2 of my mates on my team in any games we played so far,I dont want to shoot my mates i want to play with them)
RENT A GUN FOR CERTAIN AMOUNT OF DAYS???? when I got a gun and enjoyed it and said its expired That was enough for me.
The game makes you feel like you Own nothing.
I got a 7 day VIP so i got bonus money xp etc and I still feel like I achived nothing.
Expired items spam every time i log in


So many cons compared to pros and thats why its hard to rate up or down, so i rated up because you have to try it your self and because its free you have nothing to lose, dont be tempted to buy things because you will regret it.

I played mostly assault class and I was quite good at the game so I'm not writing the review on saltyness.

If you use to play Call of duty MW2 and you want a demo version, this is the game for you to enjoy casualy  for about a week or 2.

reviewText:
Chinese MMO that figuratively screams in your face to buy all kinds of pay2win gear.
Mediocre Cowadoody-style coop shooter. An okay timewaster.

Positive:
The coop isn't too bad and seems to have different missions every few days/weeks. Difficulty is quite challenging and needs the team to work effectively together instead of running headfirst into the horde alone. Mech bosses look cool but can be absolute BS with their nonstop rocket spam.
Despite so many cashshop items the versus seems suprisingly balanced at first, though there is a slight class imbalance.

Negative:
Advertisements and offers" for cashshop items everywhere. Lag pretty much at any given time
date: long loading times and unnecessary long waiting time for the result screen before you can click back to menu/lobby. Massively stupid enemy AI and glitchy gameplay now and then. BS enemies like riotshields who rush and instantly knock you down everywhere. Snipers have a 50% miss rate simply due to lag
recommended: shotguns are awful to useless past the 5 meter mark.\n\nIf you are searching for a good online FPS (especially VS) avoid it."

reviewText:
Love this game and had it on the XBOX 360 too.

Gutted when Microsoft removed it from XBOX 360 so glad that this service is still going.

Just as good and just as fun if not more.

A good game to play as a team with friends and the ability to unlock items as you go which you keep makes the game interesting and in depth.   These items include weapons, different pieces of armour and accessories (new sight, sniper tripod, silencer, etc) which you use in game to set your weapon up to your specifications.  There are obviously extra perks, weapons and boosts you can purchase, however, the game is very enjoyable without them.

Warface is updated fairly regularly and there are different game modes to play too which helps to prevent the game from becoming too monotonous.  There are also rewards for logging in everyday and special events quite regularly.

To be honest, I must say, this game does keep getting better and better.

Everything about this game is good quality and for free you can't really argue.

reviewText:
eh this game has a cool idea to the fps front, with its neat weapon attachment customization while ingame, and its fast pace matches. Its also one of my favorite free to play games.
BUT
-Loading takes a long time
-The medic class is just pointless with its defib in pvp
-Weapons are no where near balanced
-Only 4 classes and of all of them rifleman is the best
-Hackers/Cheaters are everywhere
-The vote kick system is rubbish, as in you can only vote to kick people in your team
-Spawn killing
-Some games can last way longer than you want them to
-Pay to win
-You have to pay to be a female
-If you select to play team death match you can end up playing a different gamemode
-The commutinity either just salty gamers or are sweaty bums who play the game 24/7
-Games are not ranked properly
-Claymores can be extremely over powered
-You have to be rank 13 before you can actually buy a gun and even then you can only buy it for one day!?
-Repetitive maps eg. farm day, sunset, night; its always the same ones
-Have to wait for the game to finish before you receive your exp and money, that means waiting for the long loading times
And there are probably many more i could have listed.
Over all if this wasnt a free to play game i dont think i would even pay 10p

reviewText: This game is fun! When you're in the Rookie channel! Playing in the Professional channel, you're probably fighting sweaty tryhards that have playe this game WAY TOO MUCH. This game is not fun when you're forced to play people levels 13-80 in professional channels, but when you're in the rookie channel you'll have loads of fun. This game IS NOT pay2play. reviewText: Hey This Is GySgtReaper thats is who i am known as in Warface I got to tell you this game is one of the best all around shooters of all time Crytech did a wonderfull job on this game. There is a few problems like the rank system is a little weird and the Auto Assign is sometimes funky but other then that it is a awesome game. What I like about this game is that you have to earn your gear and weapons and Armor by playing Co-op matches and Multiplayer now if you play Multiplayer here is a tip play as the engineer its one of the best classes to play you can put a claymore or any other mine down at a spot at it stays there even after you die and if you put it down where alot of people run you might get lucky and get a mine kill of a double kill the engineer is very good class for close up counters and Ambushes The sniper is also good if you are is a good spot. The Medic has a shotgun so if you get close up and personal make sure you can shoot fast because it only take one wrong move and you are dead and finally the Solider the all around class is a very good class for close med or long range but dont get cocky because alot of players think because they are soliders but anybody can kill soliders with a simple grenade or mine

reviewText:
Plus (+)

They managed to make a decent game, after crysis i mean. It's fun to play co-op with your friends also kinda good with playing aganist vs mode. Like their graphic, animation etc. I also like teamplay theme. You can climb high places with help of your teammate, or except snipers all class have something to aid you (heal-armor-ammo) their co-op missions are not bad either.

Minus (-)

Over 50+ hours i experienced several bugs, sometimes you can't hit heavy machine boss even you spot on the weak point. Or time to time you get stucked with knife or pistol and couldn't change your weapon in co-op mode for a few minutes. You heal pack may stuck or your shock thingy (couldn't remember the name) may bugged while you tried to resurrect your teammate.

Also AI may stucked few places in co-op maps, you can see them while charging wall aimlessly

Game sitll have not enough player in my point of view, you can see very few room in vs mode (except rookies rooms)

And biggest problem for me is hack programs. Wallhacks- aimbots etc. this bot programs got sub fees and despise that some dumbasses actually give money to them. Utherly pathetic but you can't help with that. So if you see anyone who headshoted you and your friends while sliding and manage to did same ♥♥♥♥ like 10-15 times just report him. Hell i even see some♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ who headshotted whole team in respawning point... Oh and in co-op mode you can see world-record bul♥♥♥♥♥, they're proably made with hack programs so don't get depressed. I experienced first hand afterall.

Also they got cash-system which seems not bad alas a bit unfair.

Soooo i give them a thumb up, cuz i really enjoyed warface till now. But it depends person to person afterall, have fun!

reviewText:
If you have homework to do, then this is the best game out there. The waiting/loading times give you all the time you need to write that essay, finish that book report, do your math, etc.
Immerse yourself in a world where logic and reason do not exists. LAfter landing inside an armored helicopter, escort a limo accross a town full of snipers, rocket launchers and tanks! why make things simple when you can make them incredibly complicated! yay.

The lack of in-game restart means that every time you fail the game you have to go back to the lobby and wait all over again. 5 minutes of play is totally worth the 10 minutes of waiting. see how you have time to do homework? take the dog for a walk while you are at it.
There are so many bugs, (you can't jump down to complete the level. Helicopter's doors won't open) the graphics are clunky and outdated.

reviewText: Hey This Is GySgtReaper thats is who i am known as in Warface I got to tell you this game is one of the best all around shooters of all time Crytech did a wonderfull job on this game. There is a few problems like the rank system is a little weird and the Auto Assign is sometimes funky but other then that it is a awesome game. What I like about this game is that you have to earn your gear and weapons and Armor by playing Co-op matches and Multiplayer now if you play Multiplayer here is a tip play as the engineer its one of the best classes to play you can put a claymore or any other mine down at a spot at it stays there even after you die and if you put it down where alot of people run you might get lucky and get a mine kill of a double kill the engineer is very good class for close up counters and Ambushes The sniper is also good if you are is a good spot. The Medic has a shotgun so if you get close up and personal make sure you can shoot fast because it only take one wrong move and you are dead and finally the Solider the all around class is a very good class for close med or long range but dont get cocky because alot of players think because they are soliders but anybody can kill soliders with a simple grenade or mine

reviewText: Great free to play game that brings variety to the traditional Co-op FPS.  Every mission can be different as you change maps, classes, equipment, and your teammates.  It also offers PvP matches which I will be trying soon.  Be warned, the missions can be frustrating as the hardcore level maps require a skilled team which is rare in pugs.

reviewText:
Plus (+)

They managed to make a decent game, after crysis i mean. It's fun to play co-op with your friends also kinda good with playing aganist vs mode. Like their graphic, animation etc. I also like teamplay theme. You can climb high places with help of your teammate, or except snipers all class have something to aid you (heal-armor-ammo) their co-op missions are not bad either.

Minus (-)

Over 50+ hours i experienced several bugs, sometimes you can't hit heavy machine boss even you spot on the weak point. Or time to time you get stucked with knife or pistol and couldn't change your weapon in co-op mode for a few minutes. You heal pack may stuck or your shock thingy (couldn't remember the name) may bugged while you tried to resurrect your teammate.

Also AI may stucked few places in co-op maps, you can see them while charging wall aimlessly

Game sitll have not enough player in my point of view, you can see very few room in vs mode (except rookies rooms)

And biggest problem for me is hack programs. Wallhacks- aimbots etc. this bot programs got sub fees and despise that some dumbasses actually give money to them. Utherly pathetic but you can't help with that. So if you see anyone who headshoted you and your friends while sliding and manage to did same ♥♥♥♥ like 10-15 times just report him. Hell i even see some♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ who headshotted whole team in respawning point... Oh and in co-op mode you can see world-record bul♥♥♥♥♥, they're proably made with hack programs so don't get depressed. I experienced first hand afterall.

Also they got cash-system which seems not bad alas a bit unfair.

Soooo i give them a thumb up, cuz i really enjoyed warface till now. But it depends person to person afterall, have fun!

reviewText:
If you want to unlock a good weapons you need to be a vip because if you don't then you need so many freakin years to unlock a DECENT one!! why i'm gonna PAY over 30$ for just being a vip while i can buy a good pvp shooter game?

Ofcourse you can take a shortcut by buying an op weapons which you can own it for only 7 days at max! and how you gonna do that? by SPENDING a real money currency which is called (Kredits) in this game and they are more expensive than CoD: MoW & BlackOps collection! (if you want to affoard a good weapon)

And there is a resurrection coins which you can resurrect from dead in co-op only which you need it mostly in Survival & Tower Raid mode and if you don't have these coins then you're doomed! you can earn 2 coins by loging in into the game 7 days in a row  which is not enough at all! so you have to buy them by spending Kredits & as i said before you need to SPEND a real money to get those!

The biggest problem of all is the huge amount of HACKERS in both PvP & Co-Op!! I've spent so damn hours and I'm still level 20!! and then i've got a new friend request and i accepted and he was level 1! after 5 days he is level 35!!!! it turned out that he is a freakin HACKER! i can't believe that someone just by shooting in the sky got to this level.. And me by playing so damn much still in that level!!! that's really NOT DAMN FAIR!

So overall this game is a total waste of time & money!! the only people who will enjoy playing this game are 2 kind:
1- Rich
2- Hacker
